A BILL FOR AN ACT

CONCERNING BENEFITS TO FACILITATE DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT WHILE SUPPORTING ELECTRIC GRID INFRASTRUCTURE, AND, IN CONNECTION THEREWITH, CREATING THE "COLORADO DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT AND GRID MODERNIZATION ACT".

Bill Summary

The bill creates the data center development and grid modernization program (program) in the Colorado office of economic development (office). To facilitate efficient data center development and grid modernization, the program allows tax and utility benefits to a data center operator that applies to the office to have a data center project certified at one of 2 levels and that satisfies certain eligibility criteria for certification.

The first level of data center project certification created in the bill is base certification. In connection with base certification, the bill specifies that:

! To obtain base certification, a data center operator must commit, through the application process with the office, to making a $250 million minimum capital investment in data center facility construction and equipment within 5 years, creating 25 full-time jobs that satisfy specified criteria, and breaking ground on the data center project within 5 years of obtaining base certification;

! In addition to the investment and job creation requirements, to obtain base certification a data center operator must also commit to implementing basic grid support capabilities, obtaining certification under one of several energy efficiency standards, implementing water stewardship strategies that optimize operational water management, sourcing at least 50% of the data center project's energy consumption from renewable and clean sources, supporting clean integration by implementing energy storage solutions that align with the data center project's needs and operations, agreeing to certain post-certification requirements, and agreeing to submit annual compliance reports to the office;

! A data center operator must apply to the office, in a form and manner to be determined by the office, for base certification before taking action to satisfy any of the eligibility criteria;

! The office is required to review a data center operator's application for base certification and award base certification to data center operators that have demonstrated that they will satisfy the base certification criteria;

! A data center operator that obtains base certification for a data center project is eligible for a 100% sales and use tax exemption on the purchase, use, and storage of information technology infrastructure, data center infrastructure, and electrical grid enhancement equipment (qualified purchases) for 20 years from the date that the data center project was certified, so long as the data center project satisfies ongoing compliance requirements; and

! In addition to the sales and use tax credit, a data center operator that obtains base certification for a data center project is eligible for standard utility rate incentives as negotiated between the data center operator and the utility.

The second level of data center certification created in the bill is enhancement certification. A data center operator that has obtained base certification for a data center project may apply for enhancement certification for the same data center. In connection with enhancement certification, the bill specifies that:

! To obtain enhancement certification, a data center operator must invest a minimum of $10 million in grid enhancement and modernization, invest in workforce development or other community benefit programs, agree to certain post-certification requirements, and agree to submit annual compliance reports to the office;

! A data center operator must apply to the office, in a form and manner to be determined by the office, for enhancement certification either before or after making the required minimum grid enhancement and modernization investment;

! The office is required to review a data center operator's application for enhancement certification and award enhancement certification to data center operators that have demonstrated that they will satisfy the enhancement certification criteria;

! For income tax years commencing on or after 2026, a data center operator that obtains enhancement certification for a data center project is eligible for an income tax credit in an amount equal to 10% of the amount of any grid enhancement and modernization investment made by the data center operator and an additional amount equal to 5% of the amount of such investment if the investment is made in a rural area (grid enhancement credit);

! A data center operator is not eligible to claim the grid enhancement credit until the data center operator has made the required minimum grid enhancement and modernization investment; and

! In addition to the grid enhancement credit, a data center operator that obtains enhancement certification for a data center project is eligible for enhanced utility benefits as negotiated between the data center operator and the utility.

Before submitting an application for certification for a data center project, a data center operator is required to conduct and document a preliminary consultation with the utility that will provide electricity for the data center project regarding interconnection feasibility, capacity, and infrastructure requirements and obtain a written feasibility assessment from the utility. A data center operator is required to include the documentation of the consultation and the written feasibility assessment with an application to the office for certification of the data center project, and, if the data center project includes projects requiring review by the public utilities commission (commission), the commission is required to review specified aspects of the application.

A certified data center project that necessitates a new customer load or co-located customer load that satisfies certain criteria (emerging new load) is eligible for targeted resource acquisition if the data center operator satisfies specified requirements. The bill specifies a process by which a utility regulated by the commission may submit a resource acquisition application to the commission to meet emerging new load needs. The bill also specifies how a utility may finance resources and infrastructure needs in connection with emerging new loads.

After achieving base certification and enhancement certification, a data center operator may apply to the office for certain benefit extensions for the sales and use tax exemption allowed to data center operators that have obtained base certification, for the grid enhancement credit allowed to data center operators that have obtained enhancement certification, and for the utility benefits negotiated between the data center operator and the utility.

If the office determines that a data center operator is not fulfilling its obligations and commitments to retain base certification or enhancement certification, the office is required to revoke the certification and the data center operator is required to repay the state for the tax benefits that it received.

Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Colorado:

SECTION 1. In Colorado Revised Statutes, add part 8 to article 48.5 of title 24 as follows:

PART 8

DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT

AND GRID MODERNIZATION

24-48.5-801. Short title. THE SHORT TITLE OF THIS PART 8 IS THE "COLORADO DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT AND GRID MODERNIZATION ACT".

24-48.5-802. Legislative declaration. (1) THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY FINDS, DETERMINES, AND DECLARES THAT:

(a) COLORADO'S CONTINUED ECONOMIC GROWTH AND TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCEMENT DEPEND ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF MODERN DIGITAL INFRASTRUCTURE THAT CAN SUPPORT EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES WHILE ENSURING GRID RELIABILITY, AFFORDABILITY OF ELECTRIC SERVICE FOR ALL CUSTOMERS, AND ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY;

(b) COLORADO FACES INTERRELATED CHALLENGES IN:

(I) ACHIEVING ITS CLEAN ENERGY AND GREENHOUSE GAS REDUCTION GOALS WHILE MAINTAINING GRID SYSTEM RELIABILITY;

(II) MODERNIZING CRITICAL ELECTRICAL GRID INFRASTRUCTURE TO SUPPORT INCREASING ELECTRIFICATION;

(III) ENSURING EQUITABLE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ACROSS URBAN, SUBURBAN, AND RURAL COMMUNITIES; AND

(IV) MAINTAINING ECONOMIC COMPETITIVENESS IN AN EVOLVING TECHNOLOGICAL LANDSCAPE;

(c) THE COLORADO ELECTRIC TRANSMISSION AUTHORITY HAS IDENTIFIED CRITICAL TRANSMISSION CAPACITY NEEDS REQUIRING APPROXIMATELY FOUR AND ONE-HALF BILLION DOLLARS IN INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT THROUGH 2045, WITH SIGNIFICANT REQUIREMENTS FOR GRID MODERNIZATION, RELIABILITY ENHANCEMENT, AND RENEWABLE AND CLEAN ENERGY INTEGRATION;

(d) DATA CENTERS REPRESENT A TRANSFORMATIVE OPPORTUNITY TO:

(I) ACCELERATE GRID MODERNIZATION THROUGH STRATEGIC INVESTMENT CONTRIBUTIONS INTO TRANSMISSION AND DISTRIBUTION INFRASTRUCTURE;

(II) CREATE HIGH-WAGE EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES ACROSS THE STATE, PARTICULARLY IN AREAS TRANSITIONING FROM TRADITIONAL ENERGY ECONOMIES; AND

(III) STRENGTHEN LOCAL TAX BASES WHILE DRIVING TECHNOLOGICAL INNOVATION;

(e) COLORADO'S EXISTING TAX STRUCTURE DOES NOT ADEQUATELY REFLECT THE UNIQUE OPERATIONAL CHARACTERISTICS AND INFRASTRUCTURE REQUIREMENTS OF MODERN DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT;

(f) THE STATE'S CURRENT TAX FRAMEWORK CREATES UNINTENDED BARRIERS TO CRITICAL DIGITAL INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT, PARTICULARLY REGARDING:

(I) LARGE-SCALE CAPITAL INVESTMENT IN TECHNOLOGICAL EQUIPMENT;

(II) ONGOING GRID INFRASTRUCTURE MODERNIZATION; AND

(III) RENEWABLE AND CLEAN ENERGY DEPLOYMENT;

(g) DATA CENTERS REPRESENT A DISTINCT CLASS OF INFRASTRUCTURE THAT:

(I) REQUIRES SIGNIFICANT UP-FRONT CAPITAL INVESTMENT;

(II) DRIVES SUBSTANTIAL GRID MODERNIZATION;

(III) CREATES HIGH-WAGE TECHNOLOGY EMPLOYMENT; AND

(IV) GENERATES LONG-TERM ECONOMIC BENEFITS;

(h) COLORADO'S CURRENT TAX FRAMEWORK HAS RESULTED IN THE STATE CAPTURING ONLY TWO PERCENT OF NATIONAL DATA CENTER INVESTMENT, AND THE STATE RISKS LOSING THREE TO FOUR BILLION DOLLARS IN POTENTIAL INVESTMENT OVER THE NEXT DECADE DESPITE SIGNIFICANT COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGES IN CLIMATE, WORKFORCE, AND RENEWABLE AND CLEAN RESOURCES;

(i) NEIGHBORING STATES HAVE ESTABLISHED COMPREHENSIVE INCENTIVE PROGRAMS THAT PLACE COLORADO AT A COMPETITIVE DISADVANTAGE;

(j) COLORADO'S BROAD FRAMEWORK OF BOLD ENERGY POLICY GOALS CREATES A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY TO DRIVE DATA CENTER INVESTMENT INTO INCREASINGLY CLEAN ENERGY MIXES LIKE THAT OF COLORADO;

(k) COLORADO'S UNIQUE GEOGRAPHIC AND RESOURCE ADVANTAGES CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR LEADERSHIP IN SUSTAINABLE DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT;

(l) A STRUCTURED, PERFORMANCE-BASED APPROACH TO DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT CAN ADVANCE MULTIPLE STATE POLICY OBJECTIVES WHILE ENSURING RESPONSIBLE DEVELOPMENT AND COMMUNITY BENEFIT; AND

(m) THE INTEGRATION OF DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT WITH TRANSMISSION PLANNING AND UTILITY OPERATIONS CAN ACCELERATE CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS NECESSARY FOR COLORADO'S CLEAN ENERGY TRANSITION.

(2) THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY FURTHER FINDS AND DECLARES THAT:

(a) A STRUCTURED, PERFORMANCE-BASED APPROACH TO DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT WILL:

(I) ACCELERATE GRID MODERNIZATION THROUGH PRIVATE INVESTMENT;

(II) ENSURE RESPONSIBLE DEVELOPMENT THAT BENEFITS LOCAL COMMUNITIES;

(III) ADVANCE MULTIPLE STATE POLICY OBJECTIVES WHILE MAINTAINING SYSTEM RELIABILITY;

(IV) CREATE HIGH-WAGE TECHNOLOGY JOBS;

(V) STRENGTHEN LOCAL TAX BASES, PARTICULARLY IN RURAL AREAS; AND

(VI) ENHANCE COLORADO'S POSITION AS A LEADER IN TECHNOLOGICAL INNOVATION;

(b) A COMPREHENSIVE FRAMEWORK FOR DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT SHOULD:

(I) SUPPORT THE EFFICIENT USE AND ENHANCEMENT OF ELECTRICAL GRID RESOURCES;

(II) PROMOTE ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY AND CLEAN ENERGY DEPLOYMENT;

(III) PRESERVE LOCAL GOVERNMENT AUTONOMY WHILE PROVIDING CONSISTENT STATEWIDE STANDARDS; AND

(IV) CREATE PREDICTABLE AND FLEXIBLE REGULATORY FRAMEWORKS THAT ENCOURAGE LONG-TERM INVESTMENT; AND

(c) A MODERNIZED TAX STRUCTURE FOR DATA CENTERS SHOULD:

(I) REFLECT THE INFRASTRUCTURE-INTENSIVE NATURE OF DATA CENTER OPERATIONS;

(II) SUPPORT EFFICIENT GRID MODERNIZATION AND USE;

(III) ALIGN WITH STATE CLEAN ENERGY OBJECTIVES; AND

(IV) ENABLE PREDICTABLE, LONG-TERM INVESTMENT.

24-48.5-803. Definitions. AS USED IN THIS PART 8, UNLESS THE CONTEXT OTHERWISE REQUIRES:

(1) "AUTHORITY" MEANS THE COLORADO ELECTRIC TRANSMISSION AUTHORITY CREATED IN SECTION 40-42-103.

(2) "BASE CERTIFICATION" MEANS CERTIFICATION GRANTED TO A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT SATISFIES THE FUNDAMENTAL QUALIFICATION CRITERIA ESTABLISHED IN SECTION 24-48.5-809.

(3) "CERTIFIED DATA CENTER PROJECT" MEANS A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT HAS BEEN CERTIFIED BY THE OFFICE PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-806.

(4) "COMMISSION" MEANS THE COLORADO PUBLIC UTILITIES COMMISSION CREATED IN SECTION 40-2-101.

(5) "DATA CENTER" MEANS A FACILITY THAT:

(a) HOUSES INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY EQUIPMENT USED FOR DATA PROCESSING, DATA STORAGE, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS; AND

(b) HAS A PRIMARY FUNCTION OF DELIVERING INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY SERVICES INCLUDING:

(I) PROVIDING DATA STORAGE, PROCESSING, AND TRANSPORT SERVICES;

(II) SUPPORTING THE DELIVERY OF CLOUD COMPUTING SERVICES;

(III) PROVIDING NETWORK CONNECTIVITY SERVICES; AND

(IV) SUPPORTING ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE, MACHINE LEARNING, OR SIMILAR COMPUTATIONAL SERVICES.

(6) "DATA CENTER OPERATOR" MEANS ANY PERSON OR ENTITY THAT:

(a) OWNS OR OPERATES A DATA CENTER IN COLORADO;

(b) IS A CLIENT OR CO-LOCATION TENANT OR LICENSEE OF A DATA CENTER; OR

(c) COLLOCATES INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY EQUIPMENT WITHIN A QUALIFYING DATA CENTER FACILITY.

(7) "DATA CENTER PROJECT" MEANS A DESIGNATED AREA THAT AGGREGATES AND CO-LOCATES ELECTRIC LOADS, INCLUDING ONE OR MORE DATA CENTERS AND RELATED INFRASTRUCTURE, NEAR CLEAN ENERGY RESOURCES TO OPTIMIZE GRID RESOURCES AND DELIVER ECONOMIC BENEFITS TO THE COMMUNITY.

(8) "DEPARTMENT" MEANS THE DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE.

(9) "EMERGING NEW LOAD" MEANS A NEW CUSTOMER LOAD OR CO-LOCATED CUSTOMER LOADS THAT:

(a) EXCEED ONE HUNDRED MEGAWATTS IN THE AGGREGATE;

(b) REQUIRE GRID INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT; AND

(c) HAVE A TIMELINE NECESSITATING EXPEDITED RESOURCE PLANNING.

(10) "ENERGY OFFICE" MEANS THE COLORADO ENERGY OFFICE CREATED IN SECTION 24-38.5-101.

(11) "ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION" MEANS CERTIFICATION GRANTED TO A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT VOLUNTARILY EXCEEDS THE BASE CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS AND SATISFIES THE ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATION CRITERIA ESTABLISHED IN SECTION 24-48.5-811.

(12) "GRID ENHANCEMENT INVESTMENT" MEANS CAPITAL INVESTMENT IN ELECTRICAL INFRASTRUCTURE THAT:

(a) IMPROVES THE CAPACITY, RELIABILITY, OR EFFICIENCY OF THE ELECTRICAL GRID;

(b) SUPPORTS THE INTEGRATION OF RENEWABLE AND CLEAN ENERGY RESOURCES;

(c) ENHANCES GRID MONITORING, CONTROL, OR OPERATIONAL CAPABILITIES;

(d) REDUCES TRANSMISSION CONSTRAINTS OR CONGESTION; AND

(e) MEETS SPECIFICATIONS ESTABLISHED BY THE COMMISSION PURSUANT TO THIS PART 8.

(13) "OFFICE" MEANS THE OFFICE OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT CREATED IN SECTION 24-48.5-101.

(14) "PROGRAM" MEANS THE DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT AND GRID MODERNIZATION PROGRAM CREATED IN THIS PART 8.

(15) "QUALIFIED PURCHASE" MEANS THE PURCHASE OF:

(a) INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY INFRASTRUCTURE INCLUDING:

(I) COMPUTER EQUIPMENT AND SOFTWARE;

(II) DATA STORAGE SYSTEMS; AND

(III) NETWORK INFRASTRUCTURE;

(b) DATA CENTER INFRASTRUCTURE AND TRANSMISSION AND GENERATION SYSTEM ASSETS INCLUDING:

(I) ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL SYSTEMS;

(II) ON-SITE ENERGY STORAGE SYSTEMS;

(III) ON-SITE RENEWABLE AND CLEAN ENERGY SYSTEMS; AND

(IV) BUILDING MATERIALS FOR DATA CENTER CONSTRUCTION;

(c) MECHANICAL SYSTEMS; OR

(d) OTHER EQUIPMENT ESSENTIAL TO DATA CENTER OPERATIONS.

(16) "RENEWABLE AND CLEAN ENERGY" MEANS ELECTRICITY GENERATED FROM:

(a) SOURCES QUALIFYING AS ELIGIBLE ENERGY RESOURCES PURSUANT TO SECTIONS 30-20-1202 (2) AND 40-2-124, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO:

(I) SOLAR;

(II) WIND;

(III) GEOTHERMAL;

(IV) BIOMASS;

(V) HYDROELECTRIC;

(VI) RECYCLED ENERGY;

(VII) NUCLEAR ENERGY; AND

(VIII) COAL MINE METHANE WHEN THE COMMISSION DETERMINES IT IS CAPTURED IN A MANNER THAT CONFORMS WITH ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONS;

(b) OTHER CLEAN ENERGY RESOURCES AS DETERMINED BY THE COMMISSION, INCLUDING:

(I) GREEN HYDROGEN; AND

(II) OTHER EMERGING ZERO-CARBON TECHNOLOGIES; AND

(c) ANY COMBINATION OF RESOURCES SPECIFIED IN THIS SUBSECTION (16).

(17) "RURAL" MEANS:

(a) A COUNTY WITH A POPULATION DENSITY OF LESS THAN ONE HUNDRED PERSONS PER SQUARE MILE ACCORDING TO THE MOST RECENT FEDERAL CENSUS; OR

(b) ANY AREA WITHIN A COUNTY THAT IS:

(I) LOCATED OUTSIDE OF A METROPOLITAN STATISTICAL AREA AS DEFINED BY THE UNITED STATES OFFICE OF MANAGEMENT AND BUDGET;

(II) LOCATED AT LEAST FIFTEEN MILES FROM THE CENTRAL BUSINESS DISTRICT OF A CITY WITH A POPULATION OF FIFTY THOUSAND OR MORE; OR

(III) DESIGNATED AS AN ENTERPRISE ZONE PURSUANT TO SECTION 39-30-103.

24-48.5-804. Data center development and grid modernization program - creation - administration - agency coordination. (1) THE DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT AND GRID MODERNIZATION PROGRAM IS CREATED IN THE OFFICE TO FACILITATE EFFICIENT DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT AND GRID MODERNIZATION BY ALLOWING TAX AND UTILITY BENEFITS TO A DATA CENTER OPERATOR THAT EITHER OWNS OR OPERATES A DATA CENTER PROJECT OR COLLECTS INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY EQUIPMENT WITHIN A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT OBTAINS BASE CERTIFICATION OR ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO THIS PART 8. THE OFFICE SHALL ADMINISTER THE PROGRAM AND SHALL COORDINATE AND SHARE RELEVANT INFORMATION WITH THE COMMISSION, THE ENERGY OFFICE, AND THE AUTHORITY TO MAXIMIZE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF THE PROGRAM.

(2) (a) THE OFFICE SHALL RECEIVE AND EVALUATE APPLICATIONS THAT ARE SUBMITTED BY DATA CENTER OPERATORS TO OBTAIN THE FOLLOWING:

(I) BASE CERTIFICATION FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT, WHICH ALLOWS THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR A SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION FOR QUALIFIED PURCHASES IN CONNECTION WITH THE DATA CENTER PROJECT PURSUANT TO SECTIONS 24-48.5-810 AND 39-26-735 AND STANDARD UTILITY RATE INCENTIVES PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-810;

(II) ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT, WHICH ALLOWS A DATA CENTER OPERATOR TO BE ELIGIBLE TO CLAIM A GRID ENHANCEMENT INVESTMENT INCOME TAX CREDIT PURSUANT TO SECTIONS 24-48.5-812 AND 39-22-571 AND ENHANCED UTILITY BENEFITS PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-812; AND

(III) A BENEFIT EXTENSION PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-813 FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT HAS OBTAINED BASE CERTIFICATION OR ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION.

(b) TO OBTAIN BASE CERTIFICATION OR ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT, OR TO OBTAIN A BENEFIT EXTENSION, A DATA CENTER OPERATOR MUST FILE A COMPLETED APPLICATION WITH THE OFFICE PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-805.

(3) THE OFFICE SHALL BEGIN PROCESSING APPLICATIONS FOR CERTIFICATION AS SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-806 WITHIN NINETY DAYS AFTER THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS PART 8. THE OFFICE SHALL COMPLETE ITS REVIEW OF ANY APPLICATION THAT IS SUBMITTED ON OR BEFORE DECEMBER 31, 2034, PURSUANT TO THE POLICIES, PROCEDURES, AND GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO THIS PART 8.

(4) IF THE OFFICE APPROVES A DATA CENTER PROJECT FOR BASE CERTIFICATION OR ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION, THE OFFICE SHALL USE THE REPORTS THAT A DATA CENTER OPERATOR IS REQUIRED TO SUBMIT TO THE OFFICE PURSUANT TO SECTIONS 24-48.5- 809 (5) AND 24-48.5-811 (5) TO MONITOR THE CERTIFIED DATA CENTER TO ENSURE THAT THE CERTIFIED DATA CENTER REMAINS IN COMPLIANCE WITH PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS.

(5) THE OFFICE SHALL ISSUE STATE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION CERTIFICATES AND TAX CREDIT CERTIFICATES REQUIRED FOR A DATA CENTER OPERATOR THAT OBTAINS BASE CERTIFICATION, ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION, OR A CERTIFIED DATA CENTER PROJECT BENEFIT EXTENSION TO CLAIM THE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION ALLOWED IN SECTIONS 24-48.5-810 AND 39-26-735 AND THE INCOME TAX CREDITS ALLOWED IN SECTIONS 24-48.5-812 AND 39-22-571.

(6) IN IMPLEMENTING THE PROGRAM, THE OFFICE SHALL:

(a) FACILITATE EFFICIENT DATA CENTER PROJECT DEVELOPMENT BY ESTABLISHING CLEAR QUALIFICATION CRITERIA AND A PREDICTABLE APPLICATION, REVIEW, AND APPROVAL PROCESS THAT IS ADMINISTERED CONSISTENTLY; AND

(b) SUPPORT STATE POLICY PRIORITIES BY:

(I) ENABLING STRATEGIC INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT;

(II) BENEFITING THE BROADER CUSTOMER BASE;

(III) OPTIMIZING GRID INFRASTRUCTURE USE;

(IV) ACCELERATING RENEWABLE AND CLEAN ENERGY DEPLOYMENT;

(V) CREATING HIGH-WAGE EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES;

(VI) GENERATING ECONOMIC BENEFITS FOR HOST COMMUNITIES;

(VII) DRIVING TECHNOLOGICAL INNOVATION; AND

(VIII) ENHANCING ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY.

(7) THE OFFICE MAY CREATE AND MODIFY POLICIES, PROCEDURES, AND GUIDELINES AS NECESSARY TO IMPLEMENT THE PROGRAM AND THE TAX AND OTHER BENEFITS THAT MAY BE CLAIMED PURSUANT TO THIS PART 8.

24-48.5-805. Application process - data center operators - requirements. (1) A DATA CENTER OPERATOR SEEKING CERTIFICATION FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT PURSUANT TO THIS PART 8 SHALL SUBMIT AN APPLICATION TO THE OFFICE, IN A FORM AND MANNER DETERMINED BY THE OFFICE, THAT INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING:

(a) INFORMATION ABOUT THE DATA CENTER PROJECT FOR WHICH THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR IS SEEKING CERTIFICATION INCLUDING:

(I) THE IDENTITY AND QUALIFICATIONS OF THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR TO OWN OR OPERATE A DATA CENTER;

(II) DETAILED GEOGRAPHIC BOUNDARIES OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT AND A SITE PLAN;

(III) EVIDENCE OF SITE CONTROL OR A PATHWAY TO SITE CONTROL;

(IV) DEVELOPMENT TIMELINE AND PHASING; AND

(V) UTILITY LOAD REQUIREMENTS;

(b) AN INFRASTRUCTURE ASSESSMENT IN CONNECTION WITH THE DATA CENTER PROJECT INCLUDING:

(I) THE PROXIMITY OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT TO EXISTING AND PLANNED TRANSMISSION CAPACITY;

(II) THE PROXIMITY OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT TO CLEAN ENERGY RESOURCES;

(III) WATER RESOURCE AVAILABILITY AND A WATER RESOURCES MANAGEMENT PLAN; AND

(IV) TRANSPORTATION AND BROADBAND ACCESS;

(c) UTILITY DOCUMENTATION IN CONNECTION WITH THE DATA CENTER PROJECT INCLUDING:

(I) THE IDENTITY OF THE UTILITY OR UTILITIES THAT WILL SERVE THE DATA CENTER PROJECT;

(II) AN EXECUTED INTERCONNECTION AGREEMENT OR UTILITY FEASIBILITY STATEMENT;

(III) A GRID INTEGRATION PLAN;

(IV) IDENTIFICATION OF NECESSARY GRID INVESTMENTS; AND

(V) BINDING COMMITMENTS FOR ALIGNMENT WITH THE HOST UTILITY'S CLEAN ENERGY PLAN;

(d) INVESTMENT AND EMPLOYMENT COMMITMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH THE DATA CENTER PROJECT INCLUDING:

(I) A TIMELINE FOR CAPITAL INVESTMENTS IN DATA CENTER PROJECT CONSTRUCTION AND EQUIPMENT REACHING A MINIMUM OF TWO HUNDRED FIFTY MILLION DOLLARS WITHIN SIXTY MONTHS;

(II) A TIMELINE FOR CAPITAL INVESTMENTS IN GRID ENHANCEMENT AND MODERNIZATION REACHING A MINIMUM OF TEN MILLION DOLLARS;

(III) A JOB CREATION PLAN SHOWING AT LEAST TWENTY-FIVE NEW FULL-TIME EQUIVALENT POSITIONS WITH COMPENSATION OF AT LEAST ONE HUNDRED TEN PERCENT OF THE COUNTY AVERAGE WAGE FOR THE COUNTY IN WHICH THE DATA CENTER PROJECT WILL BE LOCATED; AND

(IV) CONSTRUCTION EMPLOYMENT PROJECTIONS;

(e) AN ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY PLAN FOR THE DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT INCLUDES:

(I) A FACILITY CERTIFICATION COMMITMENT, INCLUDING LEED, ENERGY STAR, GREEN GLOBES, ISO 50001, OR THE EQUIVALENT;

(II) A WATER STEWARDSHIP STRATEGY;

(III) A RENEWABLE ENERGY PROCUREMENT PLAN; AND

(IV) ENERGY STORAGE AND GRID SUPPORT CAPABILITIES;

(f) GRID ENHANCEMENT COMMITMENTS FOR THE DATA CENTER PROJECT INCLUDING:

(I) AN EXECUTED AGREEMENT WITH THE HOST UTILITY FOR PLANNED GRID INVESTMENTS;

(II) A DESCRIPTION OF PLANNED GRID INVESTMENTS;

(III) A TIMELINE FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE GRID ENHANCEMENT COMMITMENTS;

(IV) INTEGRATION WITH UTILITY PLANNING; AND

(V) TECHNOLOGIES THAT WILL BE DEPLOYED;

(g) COMMUNITY BENEFIT COMMITMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH THE DATA CENTER PROJECT INCLUDING:

(I) WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVES;

(II) LOCAL SUPPLIER DEVELOPMENT;

(III) TECHNOLOGY TRAINING CENTERS;

(IV) CONSERVATION OR OPEN SPACE PROGRAMS; AND

(V) OTHER COMMUNITY INVESTMENTS; AND

(h) LOCAL GOVERNMENT DOCUMENTATION IN CONNECTION WITH THE DATA CENTER PROJECT INCLUDING:

(I) A RESOLUTION OF SUPPORT FROM THE LOCAL GOVERNING BODY THAT IS THE PERMITTING ENTITY AS REQUIRED BY SUBSECTION (3) OF THIS SECTION;

(II) A DESCRIPTION OF APPLICABLE LOCAL INCENTIVES; AND

(III) THE STATUS OF LOCAL PERMITS AND APPROVALS.

(2) (a) AS PART OF THE APPLICATION PROCESS, A DATA CENTER OPERATOR SHALL PROVIDE TO THE OFFICE AN ATTESTATION THAT:

(I) CERTIFIES THAT THE DATA CENTER PROJECT WOULD NOT HAVE OCCURRED IN THE STATE WITHOUT THE INCENTIVES PROVIDED IN THIS PART 8; AND

(II) ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THIS ATTESTATION MAY BE USED FOR FISCAL IMPACT ANALYSIS PURPOSES.

(b) THE OFFICE SHALL KEEP A RECORD OF EACH ATTESTATION SUBMITTED PURSUANT TO SUBSECTION (2)(a) OF THIS SECTION.

(3) A DATA CENTER OPERATOR SHALL PROVIDE TO THE OFFICE, AS PART OF THE APPLICATION PROCESS, A RESOLUTION OF SUPPORT FROM THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN WHICH THE DATA CENTER WILL BE LOCATED THAT IS THE PERMITTING ENTITY FOR THE DATA CENTER PROJECT. IF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT WILL BE LOCATED IN AN INCORPORATED AREA, THE INCORPORATED LOCAL GOVERNMENT IS THE PERMITTING ENTITY. IF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT WILL BE LOCATED IN AN UNINCORPORATED AREA, THE COUNTY IS THE PERMITTING ENTITY.

24-48.5-806. Application review process - opportunity to cure application - application approval - revocation of certification. (1) THE OFFICE SHALL REVIEW ALL APPLICATIONS SUBMITTED PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-805. THE OFFICE SHALL DETERMINE WHETHER AN APPLICATION IS COMPLETE WITHIN FIFTEEN DAYS AFTER THE OFFICE'S RECEIPT OF THE APPLICATION. WITHIN SIXTY DAYS OF DETERMINING THAT AN APPLICATION IS COMPLETE, THE OFFICE SHALL CONDUCT A FULL APPLICATION REVIEW.

(2) IF THE OFFICE DETERMINES THAT AN APPLICATION IS DEFICIENT, THE OFFICE SHALL PROVIDE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO THE APPLICANT THAT IDENTIFIES THE SPECIFIC DEFICIENCIES. THE OFFICE SHALL ALLOW THIRTY DAYS FOR THE APPLICANT TO CURE ANY DEFICIENCIES IN THE APPLICATION AND COMPLETE A REVIEW OF THE REVISED APPLICATION WITHIN THIRTY DAYS AFTER RECEIPT.

(3) THE OFFICE SHALL APPROVE AN APPLICATION FOR BASE OR ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT IF IT CONTAINS ALL OF THE FOLLOWING:

(a) A COMPLETE APPLICATION THAT INCLUDES ALL OF THE COMPONENTS SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-805;

(b) ATTESTATION AS SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-805 (2) THAT THE DATA CENTER PROJECT WOULD NOT HAVE OCCURRED IN THE STATE WITHOUT APPROVAL FOR BASE OR ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION; AND

(c) DOCUMENTATION OF APPROVAL FROM THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN WHICH THE DATA CENTER WILL BE LOCATED AS SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-805 (3).

(4) THE OFFICE MAY REJECT AN APPLICATION ONLY ON THE FOLLOWING GROUNDS:

(a) THE OFFICE FINDS THAT THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR MATERIALLY MISREPRESENTED FACTS IN THE APPLICATION;

(b) THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR FAILED TO PROVIDE REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION AFTER THE OFFICE PROVIDED AN OPPORTUNITY TO CURE PURSUANT TO SUBSECTION (2) OF THIS SECTION;

(c) THE OFFICE DETERMINES THAT THERE IS A DOCUMENTED INABILITY OF LOCAL INFRASTRUCTURE TO SUPPORT THE DATA CENTER PROJECT DESPITE COMMITMENTS FROM THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR; OR

(d) THE OFFICE DETERMINES THAT A CLEAR INCONSISTENCY EXISTS BETWEEN THE DATA CENTER PROJECT AND STATUTORY CLEAN ENERGY REQUIREMENTS.

(5) BEFORE REJECTING ANY APPLICATION THAT MEETS THE MINIMUM INVESTMENT AND JOB CREATION THRESHOLDS SET FORTH IN SECTION 24-48.5-805 (1)(d), THE OFFICE MUST:

(a) CONSULT WITH THE ENERGY OFFICE, THE COMMISSION, AND THE DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES REGARDING THE APPLICATION;

(b) PROVIDE THE APPLICANT AN OPPORTUNITY TO ADDRESS THE OFFICE'S CONCERNS; AND

(c) EXPLORE ALTERNATIVE PATHS TO APPROVAL WITH CONDITIONS IF POSSIBLE.

(6) THE OFFICE MAY REVOKE CERTIFICATION THAT IT HAS AWARDED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION IF THE OFFICE DETERMINES THAT THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR:

(a) HAS FAILED TO MAKE SUBSTANTIAL PROGRESS TOWARD SATISFYING THE REQUIREMENTS SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-805 (1) WITHIN TWO YEARS OF DESIGNATION;

(b) HAS MATERIALLY CHANGED THE DATA CENTER PROJECT IN WAYS THAT WOULD HAVE PREVENTED AUTOMATIC CERTIFICATION OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT; OR

(c) HAS FAILED TO MAINTAIN COMPLIANCE WITH THE CRITERIA THAT FORMED THE BASIS OF APPROVAL.

24-48.5-807. Public utilities commission integration. (1) (a) PRIOR TO SUBMITTING AN APPLICATION FOR CERTIFICATION FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT, A DATA CENTER OPERATOR SHALL:

(I) CONDUCT AND DOCUMENT A PRELIMINARY CONSULTATION WITH THE UTILITY THAT WILL PROVIDE ELECTRICITY FOR THE DATA CENTER PROJECT REGARDING INTERCONNECTION FEASIBILITY, CAPACITY, AND INFRASTRUCTURE REQUIREMENTS; AND

(II) OBTAIN A WRITTEN FEASIBILITY ASSESSMENT FROM THE UTILITY THAT WILL PROVIDE ELECTRICITY FOR THE DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT INCLUDES:

(A) AVAILABLE TRANSMISSION AND DISTRIBUTION CAPACITY;

(B) POTENTIAL GRID CONSTRAINTS;

(C) A PRELIMINARY TIMELINE FOR INTERCONNECTION; AND

(D) A HIGH-LEVEL SUMMARY ESTIMATING REQUIRED SYSTEM UPGRADES.

(b) A DATA CENTER OPERATOR SHALL INCLUDE THE DOCUMENTATION OF THE CONSULTATION AND THE WRITTEN FEASIBILITY ASSESSMENT OBTAINED PURSUANT TO SUBSECTION (1)(a) OF THIS SECTION IN THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR'S APPLICATION TO THE OFFICE SUBMITTED PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-805.

(2) (a) UPON RECEIPT OF AN APPLICATION FOR CERTIFICATION OF A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT INCLUDES PROJECTS REQUIRING COMMISSION REVIEW, THE OFFICE SHALL:

(I) WITHIN FIVE BUSINESS DAYS, NOTIFY THE COMMISSION OF THE APPLICATION;

(II) PROVIDE RELEVANT PORTIONS OF THE APPLICATION TO THE COMMISSION FOR CONCURRENT REVIEW; AND

(III) ESTABLISH A JOINT REVIEW TIMELINE THAT ALIGNS WITH THE SIXTY-DAY APPLICATION REVIEW PERIOD SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-806 (1).

(b) THE COMMISSION SHALL REVIEW ANY APPLICATION THAT THE OFFICE PROVIDES TO THE COMMISSION PURSUANT TO SUBSECTION (2)(a) OF THIS SECTION. IN ITS REVIEW, THE COMMISSION SHALL FOCUS EXCLUSIVELY ON:

(I) THE TECHNICAL FEASIBILITY OF THE PROPOSED GRID CONNECTIONS;

(II) SYSTEM RELIABILITY IMPACTS;

(III) THE APPROPRIATE COST ALLOCATION; AND

(IV) ALIGNMENT WITH CLEAN ENERGY REQUIREMENTS.

(c) THE COMMISSION SHALL PROVIDE ADVISORY INPUT TO THE OFFICE WITHIN FORTY-FIVE DAYS AFTER RECEIVING NOTIFICATION PURSUANT TO SUBSECTION (2)(a)(I) OF THIS SECTION.

(3) (a) FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT REQUIRES NEW ELECTRIC GENERATION RESOURCES THAT WOULD REQUIRE COMMISSION REVIEW, THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR AND SERVING UTILITY MAY JOINTLY SUBMIT A SIMPLIFIED RESOURCE ACQUISITION APPLICATION TO THE COMMISSION THAT INCLUDES:

(I) A DESCRIPTION OF THE PROPOSED GENERATION RESOURCES;

(II) A TIMELINE FOR DEPLOYMENT;

(III) A COST ALLOCATION FRAMEWORK; AND

(IV) AN UPDATED EMISSIONS WORKBOOK SHOWING THE IMPACT OF THE NEW LOAD AND RESOURCES.

(b) THE COMMISSION SHALL REVIEW A SIMPLIFIED RESOURCE ACQUISITION APPLICATION WITHIN NINETY DAYS AFTER RECEIPT.

(4) (a) FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT REQUIRES TRANSMISSION OR DISTRIBUTION UPGRADES THAT WOULD REQUIRE COMMISSION REVIEW, THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR HAS THE FOLLOWING OPTIONS:

(I) A DATA CENTER OPERATOR-FUNDED OPTION UNDER WHICH THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR FULLY FUNDS THE REQUIRED INFRASTRUCTURE UPGRADES AND THE UPGRADES BECOME ASSETS OF THE UTILITY SYSTEM. FOR THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR-FUNDED OPTION, THE COMMISSION'S REVIEW IS LIMITED TO TECHNICAL STANDARDS AND SYSTEM INTEGRATION, AND THE COMMISSION MUST REVIEW THE COMPLETED APPLICATION WITHIN FORTY-FIVE DAYS AFTER RECEIPT.

(II) A CO-INVESTMENT OPTION UNDER WHICH THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR AND THE UTILITY SHARE THE INVESTMENT COST, AND COSTS ARE ALLOCATED BASED ON A SYSTEM BENEFITS ANALYSIS. FOR THE CO-INVESTMENT OPTION, THE COMMISSION REVIEWS ONLY THE COST ALLOCATION METHODOLOGY, AND THE COMMISSION MUST REVIEW THE COMPLETED APPLICATION WITHIN SIXTY DAYS AFTER RECEIPT.

(III) A SYSTEM-FUNDED OPTION UNDER WHICH THE UTILITY FUNDS INFRASTRUCTURE THROUGH TRADITIONAL RATEMAKING, AND THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR PAYS SPECIAL FACILITIES CHARGES AS APPLICABLE. FOR THE SYSTEM-FUNDED OPTION, THE COMMISSION REVIEWS THE RATE IMPACTS AND SYSTEM BENEFITS, AND THE COMMISSION MUST REVIEW THE COMPLETED APPLICATION WITHIN NINETY DAYS AFTER RECEIPT.

(5) THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT REQUIRES COMMISSION REVIEW SHALL SUBMIT A CLEAN ENERGY COMPLIANCE PLAN TO THE COMMISSION. THE COMMISSION SHALL PROVIDE VERIFICATION CRITERIA WITHIN THIRTY DAYS AFTER SUBMISSION OF A CLEAN ENERGY COMPLIANCE PLAN. THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT SHALL REPORT ANNUAL COMPLIANCE USING STANDARDIZED METRICS.

(6) THE COMMISSION SHALL DESIGNATE A DATA CENTER PROJECT COORDINATOR WHO SHALL:

(a) SERVE AS THE PRIMARY LIAISON FOR DATA CENTER OPERATORS;

(b) COORDINATE THE INTERNAL COMMISSION REVIEW PROCESSES;

(c) FACILITATE COMMUNICATION BETWEEN DATA CENTER OPERATORS, UTILITIES, AND COMMISSION STAFF;

(d) IDENTIFY POTENTIAL REGULATORY ISSUES EARLY IN THE DEVELOPMENT PROCESS; AND

(e) RECOMMEND PROCESS IMPROVEMENTS BASED ON EXPERIENCE.

(7) FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT LOCATED IN THE SERVICE TERRITORY OF A MUNICIPALLY-OWNED UTILITY, A DATA CENTER OPERATOR SHALL COMPLY WITH A SUBSTANTIALLY SIMILAR PROCESS TO THE PROCESS DESCRIBED IN SUBSECTIONS (1) TO (6) OF THIS SECTION WITH THE MUNICIPALLY-OWNED UTILITY.

24-48.5-808. Targeted resource acquisition for emerging new loads. (1) A CERTIFIED DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT NECESSITATES AN EMERGING NEW LOAD IS ELIGIBLE FOR TARGETED RESOURCE ACQUISITION IF THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR:

(a) COMMITS TO MINIMUM DEMAND AND DURATION REQUIREMENTS AND TO THE APPLICABLE REQUIREMENTS OF THIS PART 8;

(b) TO ALLOW FOR REVENUE RECOVERY, AGREES TO EXIT FEE PARAMETERS, INCLUDING A THREE-YEAR STRUCTURE;

(c) PROVIDES APPROPRIATE CREDIT SECURITIZATION; AND

(d) DEMONSTRATES SITE CONTROL WITH SIGNED DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENTS.

(2) (a) A UTILITY THAT IS SUBJECT TO THE JURISDICTION OF THE COMMISSION AND THAT NEEDS TO ACQUIRE RESOURCES TO MEET THE EMERGING NEW LOAD FOR A CERTIFIED DATA CENTER PROJECT MAY SUBMIT A RESOURCE ACQUISITION APPLICATION TO THE COMMISSION.

(b) PRIOR TO FILING A RESOURCE ACQUISITION APPLICATION WITH THE COMMISSION, A UTILITY MAY CONDUCT COMPETITIVE SOLICITATIONS TO IDENTIFY POTENTIAL RESOURCES TO SERVE THE EMERGING NEW LOAD WITH IDENTIFIED RESOURCES SOLICITATION RESPONSES. A UTILITY MAY INCLUDE THE RESPONSES TO THE SOLICITATIONS IN THE RESOURCE ACQUISITION APPLICATION.

(c) (I) EXCEPT AS PROVIDED IN SUBSECTION (2)(c)(II) OF THIS SECTION, A UTILITY SHALL USE A COMPETITIVE PROCESS TO ACQUIRE RESOURCES THAT REQUIRES:

(A) THE UTILITY TO WORK WITH THE OPERATOR OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT NECESSITATING EMERGING NEW LOAD TO IDENTIFY GRID SYSTEM ASSETS THAT THE LOAD MAY FUND IN WHOLE OR IN PART;

(B) THAT THE ASSETS OPERATE FOR THE BENEFIT OF ALL CUSTOMERS; AND

(C) THAT THE RESOURCES HAVE SUFFICIENT CAPACITY TO MEET THE EMERGING NEW LOAD'S NEEDS, WHICH CAPACITY MAY BE STAGGERED OVER TIME.

(II) A UTILITY MAY USE PREVIOUSLY IDENTIFIED RESOURCES, IN LIEU OF A NEW REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS, IF THE BID FOR PREVIOUSLY IDENTIFIED RESOURCES WAS SUBMITTED TO THE COMMISSION WITHIN THE IMMEDIATELY PRECEEDING TWO YEARS AND THE BID PRICE IS CONSISTENT.

(d) (I) THE UTILITY SHALL PROVIDE THE COMMISSION WITH AN UPDATED EMISSIONS WORKBOOK THAT:

(A) SHOWS BOTH THE EMERGING NEW LOAD AND PROPOSED RESOURCES IF THEY ARE A PART OF THE UTILITY'S APPLICATION;

(B) SHOWS TOTAL MEGAWATT HOURS AND GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS AS SEPARATE REPORTING CATEGORIES; AND

(C) REPORTS EACH EMERGING NEW LOAD FOR THE PURPOSE OF CO-LOCATING EMERGING NEW LOADS TO THE EXTENT PRACTICABLE.

(e) IF THE COMMISSION APPROVES A UTILITY'S RESOURCE ACQUISITION APPLICATION, THE APPROVAL ESTABLISHES A PRESUMPTION OF PRUDENCE FOR ALL ACTIVITIES UNDERTAKEN FOR RESOURCE ACQUISITION AND NECESSARY INFRASTRUCTURE DEVELOPMENT.

(f) THE STANDARD OF REVIEW OF THE COMMISSION'S DECISION ON A UTILITY'S RESOURCE ACQUISITION APPLICATION IS WHETHER THE RESOURCE ACQUISITION IS IN THE PUBLIC INTEREST.

(g) IF THE UTILITY IDENTIFIES SPECIFIC RESOURCES, THE UTILITY IS NOT REQUIRED TO APPLY FOR OR OBTAIN A CERTIFICATE OF PUBLIC CONVENIENCE AND NECESSITY PURSUANT TO SECTION 40-5-102.

(h) THE COMMISSION SHALL APPROVE, MODIFY, OR DENY APPLICATIONS WITHIN ONE HUNDRED TWENTY DAYS AFTER FILING, WITH TEN-DAY INTERVENTION PERIODS.

(3) (a) UTILITIES MAY INCLUDE PRE-FUNDING COMMITMENTS FROM THE OPERATOR OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT NECESSITATING EMERGING NEW LOAD FOR PRE-DEVELOPMENT AND EARLY CONSTRUCTION COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH RESOURCE ACQUISITION OR TRANSMISSION OR DISTRIBUTION INFRASTRUCTURE TO SERVE THE EMERGING NEW LOAD.

(b) (I) THE COSTS SPECIFIED IN SUBSECTION (3)(a) OF THIS SECTION MAY BE ABSORBED BY THE OPERATOR OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT NECESSITATING EMERGING NEW LOAD, OR THE UTILITY MAY PROPOSE REIMBURSEMENT OF THE OPERATOR OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT NECESSITATING EMERGING NEW LOAD WITH ADJUSTMENT CLAUSE RECOVERY IF THE RESOURCES BENEFIT THE ELECTRIC SYSTEM.

(II) THE COMMISSION SHALL APPROVE THE REIMBURSEMENT RECOVERY IF THE COMMISSION FINDS THAT THE RESOURCES AND INFRASTRUCTURE PROVIDE A BENEFIT TO THE ELECTRIC SYSTEM.

(III) ONCE COMMERCIAL OPERATION OF THE DATA CENTER BEGINS, THE UTILITY MAY RECOVER ITS COSTS THROUGH APPROPRIATE ADJUSTMENT CLAUSES UNTIL THE COSTS ARE ROLLED INTO THE RATE BASE IN A FUTURE RATE CASE FILING.

(c) (I) A UTILITY MAY ESTABLISH AN ADVANCED ENERGY TECHNOLOGIES FUND THAT ALLOWS OPERATORS OF DATA CENTER PROJECTS NECESSITATING EMERGING NEW LOADS TO CONTRIBUTE MONEY TO THE FUND AHEAD OF DEVELOPMENT, TO COVER PRE-DEVELOPMENT AND EARLY CONSTRUCTION COSTS. CONTRIBUTIONS ARE NOT MANDATORY AND ARE INTENDED TO ENSURE THE COMMITMENT OF OPERATORS OF DATA CENTER PROJECTS NECESSITATING EMERGING NEW LOADS COMING ONLINE AND TO STRENGTHEN THE CASE FOR APPROVAL BY THE COMMISSION.

(II) UPON APPROVAL OF THE COMMISSION, MONEY SHALL BE USED TO:

(A) PAY FOR PRE-DEVELOPMENT AND EARLY CONSTRUCTION COSTS;

(B) SUPPORT EXPLORATION OF CLEAN FIRM DISPATCHABLE TECHNOLOGIES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE OPERATOR OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT NECESSITATING EMERGING NEW LOAD; OR

(C) PROVIDE CUSTOMER COMPENSATION COSTS BORNE BY THE UTILITY FOR INFRASTRUCTURE IF PROJECTS DO NOT MATERIALIZE.

(III) IN EXCHANGE FOR A CONTRIBUTION TO THE FUND BY THE OPERATOR OF A DATA CENTER PROJECT NECESSITATING EMERGING NEW LOAD, THE FUND MAY INCLUDE A PROVISION THAT THE OPERATOR OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT NECESSITATING EMERGING NEW LOAD HAVE ADVANCED ENERGY TECHNOLOGIES LOCATED IN AREAS OF THE SYSTEM WHERE THEY CAN BENEFIT FROM CLEAN DISPATCHABLE POWER.

(IV) THE FUND MAY BE USED TO MANAGE AND ALLOCATE ADVANCED ENERGY TECHNOLOGY RISK IN AN APPROPRIATE MANNER.

(4) (a) THIS SECTION OPERATES IN COORDINATION WITH THE COMMISSION INTEGRATION PROCEDURES SET FORTH IN SECTION 24-48.5-807.

(b) FOR CERTIFIED DATA CENTERS, THE UTILITY SHALL COORDINATE WITH THE OFFICE TO ENSURE CONSISTENCY.

(c) NOTHING IN THIS SECTION LIMITS THE AUTHORITY OF THE COMMISSION PURSUANT TO TITLE 40.

24-48.5-809. Certified data center project status - base certification - application - requirements - qualification.(1) A DATA CENTER OPERATOR MAY APPLY TO THE OFFICE PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-805 TO OBTAIN BASE CERTIFICATION FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT. A DATA CENTER OPERATOR MUST APPLY TO THE OFFICE FOR BASE CERTIFICATION BEFORE SATISFYING ANY OF THE CRITERIA SPECIFIED IN SUBSECTION (2) OF THIS SECTION.

(2) TO QUALIFY FOR BASE CERTIFICATION, A DATA CENTER OPERATOR MUST DEMONSTRATE TO THE OFFICE THAT IT COMMITS TO:

(a) MAKE A MINIMUM CAPITAL INVESTMENT OF TWO HUNDRED FIFTY MILLION DOLLARS IN DATA CENTER FACILITY CONSTRUCTION AND EQUIPMENT WITHIN SIXTY MONTHS OF OBTAINING BASE CERTIFICATION FROM THE OFFICE AS SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-805 (1)(d);

(b) CREATE TWENTY-FIVE NEW FULL-TIME EQUIVALENT JOBS WITH AN AVERAGE COMPENSATION OF AT LEAST ONE HUNDRED TEN PERCENT OF THE COUNTY AVERAGE WAGE IN THE COUNTY IN WHICH THE DATA CENTER PROJECT WILL BE CONSTRUCTED;

(c) IMPLEMENT BASIC GRID SUPPORT CAPABILITIES INCLUDING:

(I) INSTALLATION OF LOAD MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS; AND

(II) COORDINATION WITH TRANSMISSION PLANNING EFFORTS;

(d) OBTAIN CERTIFICATION UNDER ONE OF THE FOLLOWING STANDARDS WITHIN TWENTY-FOUR MONTHS OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT BEING PLACED IN SERVICE:

(I) LEED FOR DATA CENTERS AT SILVER LEVEL OR HIGHER;

(II) ENERGY STAR CERTIFICATION;

(III) GREEN GLOBES CERTIFICATION;

(IV) ISO 50001 ENERGY MANAGEMENT CERTIFICATION;

(V) ISO 14001 STANDARD FOR ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS; OR

(VI) OTHER EQUIVALENT STANDARDS APPROVED BY THE OFFICE;

(e) IMPLEMENT WATER STEWARDSHIP STRATEGIES THAT OPTIMIZE OPERATIONAL WATER MANAGEMENT THROUGH ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING:

(I) IMPLEMENTATION OF CLOSED-LOOP COOLING SYSTEMS;

(II) USE OF AVAILABLE RECYCLED WATER SOURCES OR WATER RIGHTS PREVIOUSLY RESERVED FOR RETIRING THERMAL POWER UNITS;

(III) DEPLOYMENT OF WATER-EFFICIENT TECHNOLOGIES; OR

(IV) REGULAR EFFICIENCY AUDITING AND IMPROVEMENT;

(f) ALIGN WITH THE ACTUAL ATTAINMENT OF THE CLEAN ENERGY PLAN OF THE UTILITY THAT WILL SERVE THE DATA CENTER PROJECT, IF THE ENERGY IS AVAILABLE, THROUGH THE UTILITY'S UPDATE TO ITS CEP WORKBOOK, EITHER SUBMITTED TO THE COMMISSION OR APPROVED BY THE UTILITY'S BOARD, WITHIN TEN YEARS OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT BEING PLACED IN SERVICE THROUGH ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING OR OTHER SOURCES DESIGNATED BY THE COMMISSION OR MUNICIPAL OR COOPERATIVE BOARD FOR NONJURISDICTIONAL UTILITIES:

(I) COLLOCATED RENEWABLE AND CLEAN ENERGY GENERATION FACILITIES;

(II) DIRECT POWER PURCHASE AGREEMENTS WITH NEW RENEWABLE AND CLEAN ENERGY FACILITIES LOCATED IN COLORADO;

(III) ENROLLMENT IN A UTILITY-ADMINISTERED VOLUNTARY GREEN PRICING PROGRAM APPROVED BY THE COMMISSION;

(IV) EXECUTION OF A POWER PURCHASE AGREEMENT WITH A MERCHANT POWER PRODUCER THAT SOURCES ELECTRICITY FROM RENEWABLE OR CLEAN RESOURCES IN ALIGNMENT WITH THE STATE'S CLEAN ENERGY GOALS;

(V) DIRECT OWNERSHIP OR PROCUREMENT OF BEHIND-THE-METER RENEWABLE OR CLEAN ENERGY GENERATION, WITH VERIFIABLE TRACKING OF ENERGY CONSUMPTION; OR

(VI) THE PURCHASE OF RENEWABLE ENERGY CERTIFICATES ENSURING COMPLIANCE WITH THE STATE'S RENEWABLE ENERGY TARGETS;

(g) SUPPORT CLEAN ENERGY INTEGRATION THROUGH COORDINATION WITH THE UTILITY OR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF ENERGY STORAGE SOLUTIONS THAT ALIGN WITH FACILITY NEEDS AND OPERATIONS;

(h) BREAK GROUND ON THE DATA CENTER PROJECT WITHIN SIXTY MONTHS OF OBTAINING BASE CERTIFICATION; AND

(i) COMMIT TO SATISFYING THE DATA CENTER PROJECT REQUIREMENTS AFTER CERTIFICATION SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-815.

(3) (a) UPON RECEIPT OF AN APPLICATION FOR BASE CERTIFICATION FROM A DATA CENTER OPERATOR, THE OFFICE SHALL REVIEW THE APPLICATION PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-806. IF THE OFFICE APPROVES THE DATA CENTER PROJECT FOR BASE CERTIFICATION, THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR BECOMES ELIGIBLE, AS OF THE DATE OF CERTIFICATION, FOR THE BASE CERTIFICATION DATA CENTER PROJECT BENEFITS SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-810.

(b) AS PART OF ITS APPLICATION FOR BASE CERTIFICATION FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT, A DATA CENTER OPERATOR MAY EXPRESS INTENT TO APPLY FOR ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-811.

(4) THE OFFICE SHALL ISSUE A STATE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION CERTIFICATE TO A DATA CENTER OPERATOR THAT HAS OBTAINED BASE CERTIFICATION FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT, AS EVIDENCE THAT THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR IS ELIGIBLE FOR A ONE HUNDRED PERCENT SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION FOR QUALIFIED PURCHASES PURSUANT TO SECTIONS 24-48.5-810 AND 39-26-735. THE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION CERTIFICATE SHALL SPECIFY THAT THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR IS ENTITLED TO THE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION FOR TWENTY YEARS, BEGINNING ON THE DATE THAT THE CERTIFICATE IS ISSUED. A STATE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION CERTIFICATE IS NONTRANSFERABLE. THE OFFICE SHALL CERTIFY TO THE DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE THE NAME OF EACH DATA CENTER OPERATOR THAT RECEIVES A STATE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION CERTIFICATE AND OTHER RELEVANT INFORMATION RELATING TO THE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION.

(5) A DATA CENTER OPERATOR OF A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT HAS OBTAINED BASE CERTIFICATION SHALL SUBMIT AN ANNUAL COMPLIANCE REPORT TO THE OFFICE, IN A FORM AND MANNER TO BE DETERMINED BY THE OFFICE, TO VERIFY THAT THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR IS MAKING TIMELY PROGRESS IN SATISFYING THE REQUIREMENTS OF SUBSECTION (2) OF THIS SECTION AND IS ON TRACK TO SATISFY THE REQUIREMENTS WITHIN THE PERIODS SPECIFIED IN THIS SECTION. A DATA CENTER OPERATOR SHALL SUBMIT THE REPORT REQUIRED IN THIS SUBSECTION (5) FOR AS LONG AS THE DATA CENTER PROJECT MAINTAINS BASE CERTIFICATION. THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR SHALL INCLUDE IN THE REPORT THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF THE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION CLAIMED IN EACH YEAR AND ANY OTHER INFORMATION REQUESTED BY THE OFFICE.

(6) IF THE OFFICE REVOKES THE BASE CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-806 (6), THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR IS REQUIRED TO PAY THE ENTIRE AMOUNT OF THE SALES AND USE TAX ON ANY QUALIFIED PURCHASE FOR WHICH THE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION WAS CLAIMED PURSUANT TO THIS PART 8.

24-48.5-810. Base certification benefits - state sales and use tax exemption - utility rate incentives. (1) (a) A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT HAS OBTAINED BASE CERTIFICATION IS ELIGIBLE FOR A ONE-HUNDRED-PERCENT STATE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION ON QUALIFIED PURCHASES PURSUANT TO SECTION 39-26-735.

(b) A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT OBTAINS BASE CERTIFICATION AND IS ELIGIBLE TO CLAIM A STATE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION PURSUANT TO SUBSECTION (1)(a) OF THIS SECTION IS ELIGIBLE FOR THE EXEMPTION FOR TWENTY YEARS FROM THE DATE THAT THE DATA CENTER PROJECT RECEIVED BASE CERTIFICATION, SO LONG AS THE DATA CENTER PROJECT:

(I) MAINTAINS THE QUALIFYING EMPLOYMENT LEVELS SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-809 (2)(b);

(II) MEETS THE ENVIRONMENTAL AND GRID PERFORMANCE STANDARDS SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-809 (2)(c) TO (2)(g); AND

(III) SUBMITS ANNUAL COMPLIANCE REPORTS TO THE OFFICE AS REQUIRED IN SECTION 24-48.5-809 (5).

(c) A DATA CENTER OPERATOR THAT OBTAINS BASE CERTIFICATION AND IS ELIGIBLE TO CLAIM THE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION PURSUANT TO SUBSECTION (1)(a) OF THIS SECTION MAY APPLY TO THE OFFICE FOR A BENEFIT EXTENSION PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-813 TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR THE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION FOR AN ADDITIONAL TEN YEARS.

(2) IN ADDITION TO THE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION ALLOWED PURSUANT TO SUBSECTION (1) OF THIS SECTION, A DATA CENTER OPERATOR THAT OBTAINS BASE CERTIFICATION IS ELIGIBLE FOR ACCESS TO APPLICABLE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT UTILITY RATES, SUBJECT TO THE APPROVAL OF THE GOVERNING BOARD OF ANY MUNICIPAL UTILITY OR COOPERATIVE ELECTRIC ASSOCIATION OR THE COMMISSION FOR AN INVESTOR-OWNED UTILITY.

24-48.5-811. Certified data center project status - enhancement certification - application - requirements - qualification. (1) A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT HAS OBTAINED BASE CERTIFICATION MAY APPLY TO THE OFFICE FOR ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION.

(2) TO QUALIFY FOR ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION, A DATA CENTER OPERATOR MUST COMMIT TO:

(a) INVESTING A MINIMUM OF TEN MILLION DOLLARS IN GRID ENHANCEMENT AND MODERNIZATION NECESSARY TO MEET LARGE-LOAD DATA CENTER NEEDS IN ONE OR A COMBINATION OF THE FOLLOWING:

(I) ADVANCED TRANSMISSION TECHNOLOGIES;

(II) ENERGY STORAGE SYSTEMS;

(III) SMART GRID INFRASTRUCTURE; OR

(IV) OTHER QUALIFYING INVESTMENTS AS DEFINED BY THE OFFICE;

(b) INVESTING IN COMMUNITY BENEFIT PROGRAMS INCLUDING:

(I) WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVES;

(II) LOCAL SUPPLIER DEVELOPMENT;

(III) TECHNOLOGY TRAINING CENTERS; OR

(IV) CONSERVATION OR OPEN SPACE PROGRAMS; AND

(c) SATISFYING THE DATA CENTER PROJECT REQUIREMENTS AFTER CERTIFICATION SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-815.

(3) (a) UPON RECEIPT OF AN APPLICATION FOR ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION FROM A DATA CENTER OPERATOR, THE OFFICE SHALL REVIEW THE APPLICATION PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-806. IF THE OFFICE APPROVES THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR FOR ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION, THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR BECOMES ELIGIBLE, AS OF THE DATE OF CERTIFICATION, FOR THE ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION DATA CENTER BENEFITS SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-812; EXCEPT THAT THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR IS NOT ELIGIBLE TO CLAIM AN INCOME TAX CREDIT ALLOWED FOR GRID ENHANCEMENT INVESTMENTS PURSUANT TO SECTIONS 24-48.5-812 AND 39-22-571 UNTIL THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR HAS MADE A TOTAL INVESTMENT OF AT LEAST TEN MILLION DOLLARS IN GRID ENHANCEMENT AND MODERNIZATION PURSUANT TO SUBSECTION (2)(a) OF THIS SECTION.

(b) (I) WHEN A DATA CENTER OPERATOR HAS MADE A TOTAL INVESTMENT OF AT LEAST TEN MILLION DOLLARS IN GRID ENHANCEMENT AND MODERNIZATION, THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR MUST SUBMIT PROOF OF SUCH INVESTMENT, IN A MANNER TO BE DETERMINED BY THE OFFICE, TO BE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE A TAX CREDIT CERTIFICATE FROM THE OFFICE PURSUANT TO SUBSECTION (4) OF THIS SECTION. A DATA CENTER OPERATOR MUST SUBMIT PROOF THAT IT MADE A TEN MILLION DOLLAR INVESTMENT IN THE INCOME TAX YEAR IN WHICH THE INVESTMENT REQUIREMENT WAS SATISFIED.

(II) A DATA CENTER OPERATOR MUST SUBMIT PROOF OF ANY INVESTMENT IN GRID ENHANCEMENT AND MODERNIZATION MADE IN ADDITION TO THE REQUIRED TEN MILLION DOLLAR INVESTMENT TO RECEIVE A TAX CREDIT CERTIFICATE FOR THE ADDITIONAL INVESTMENT. THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR MUST SUBMIT PROOF TO THE OFFICE OF THE INVESTMENT IN THE INCOME TAX YEAR IN WHICH THE INVESTMENT WAS MADE.

(4) (a) THE OFFICE SHALL ISSUE A TAX CREDIT CERTIFICATE TO A DATA CENTER OPERATOR THAT HAS MADE A REQUIRED INVESTMENT OF AT LEAST TEN MILLION DOLLARS IN GRID ENHANCEMENT AND MODERNIZATION AND SHALL ISSUE A TAX CREDIT CERTIFICATE FOR ANY ADDITIONAL INVESTMENT. THE TAX CREDIT CERTIFICATE SHALL STATE THE AMOUNT OF THE GRID ENHANCEMENT INVESTMENT TAX CREDIT THAT IS AUTHORIZED PURSUANT TO SECTIONS 24-48.5-812 AND 39-22-571. A TAX CREDIT CERTIFICATE IS NON TRANSFERRABLE. THE OFFICE SHALL CERTIFY TO THE DEPARTMENT THE NAME OF EACH DATA CENTER OPERATOR WHO RECEIVES A TAX CREDIT CERTIFICATE, THE AMOUNT OF THE TAX CREDIT ALLOWED, AND ANY OTHER RELEVANT INFORMATION REGARDING THE TAX CREDIT.

(b) TO CLAIM A GRID ENHANCEMENT INVESTMENT TAX CREDIT, A DATA CENTER OPERATOR MUST SUBMIT A COPY OF EACH TAX CREDIT CERTIFICATE ISSUED BY THE OFFICE PURSUANT TO SUBSECTION (3) OF THIS SECTION AS PART OF A TAX RETURN TO THE DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECTION 39-22-571 BY THE DUE DATE OF THE RETURN, INCLUDING EXTENSIONS, FOR THE TAX YEAR DURING WHICH THE INVESTMENT WAS MADE, OR, IN THE CASE OF THE REQUIRED TEN MILLION DOLLAR INVESTMENT, FOR THE TAX YEAR DURING WHICH THE INVESTMENT REQUIREMENT WAS SATISFIED.

A DATA CENTER OPERATOR SHALL SUBMIT THE REPORT REQUIRED IN THIS SUBSECTION (5) FOR AS LONG AS THE DATA CENTER PROJECT MAINTAINS ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION. THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR SHALL INCLUDE IN THE REPORT ANY INFORMATION REQUESTED BY THE OFFICE.

(6) IF THE OFFICE REVOKES THE ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-806 (6), THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR IS NOT QUALIFIED FOR FURTHER BENEFITS ALLOWED FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT HAS OBTAINED ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION.

**A BILL FOR AN ACT**

**CONCERNING BENEFITS TO FACILITATE DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT WHILE SUPPORTING
ELECTRIC GRID INFRASTRUCTURE, AND, IN CONNECTION THEREWITH, CREATING THE
"COLORADO DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT AND GRID MODERNIZATION ACT".**

**Bill Summary**

The bill creates the data center development and grid modernization program
(program) in the Colorado office of economic development (office). To
facilitate efficient data center development and grid modernization, the
program allows tax and utility benefits to a data center operator that applies
to the office to have a data center project certified at one of 2 levels and
that satisfies certain eligibility criteria for certification.

The first level of data center project certification created in the bill is
base certification. In connection with base certification, the bill specifies
that:

! To obtain base certification, a data center operator must commit, through
the application process with the office, to making a $250 million minimum
capital investment in data center facility construction and equipment within 5
years, creating 25 full-time jobs that satisfy specified criteria, and
breaking ground on the data center project within 5 years of obtaining base
certification;

! In addition to the investment and job creation requirements, to obtain base
certification a data center operator must also commit to implementing basic
grid support capabilities, obtaining certification under one of several energy
efficiency standards, implementing water stewardship strategies that optimize
operational water management, sourcing at least 50% of the data center
project's energy consumption from renewable and clean sources, supporting
clean integration by implementing energy storage solutions that align with the
data center project's needs and operations, agreeing to certain post-
certification requirements, and agreeing to submit annual compliance reports
to the office;

! A data center operator must apply to the office, in a form and manner to be
determined by the office, for base certification before taking action to
satisfy any of the eligibility criteria;

! The office is required to review a data center operator's application for
base certification and award base certification to data center operators that
have demonstrated that they will satisfy the base certification criteria;

! A data center operator that obtains base certification for a data center
project is eligible for a 100% sales and use tax exemption on the purchase,
use, and storage of information technology infrastructure, data center
infrastructure, and electrical grid enhancement equipment (qualified
purchases) for 20 years from the date that the data center project was
certified, so long as the data center project satisfies ongoing compliance
requirements; and

! In addition to the sales and use tax credit, a data center operator that
obtains base certification for a data center project is eligible for standard
utility rate incentives as negotiated between the data center operator and the
utility.

The second level of data center certification created in the bill is
enhancement certification. A data center operator that has obtained base
certification for a data center project may apply for enhancement
certification for the same data center. In connection with enhancement
certification, the bill specifies that:

! To obtain enhancement certification, a data center operator must invest a
minimum of $10 million in grid enhancement and modernization, invest in
workforce development or other community benefit programs, agree to certain
post-certification requirements, and agree to submit annual compliance reports
to the office;

! A data center operator must apply to the office, in a form and manner to be
determined by the office, for enhancement certification either before or after
making the required minimum grid enhancement and modernization investment;

! The office is required to review a data center operator's application for
enhancement certification and award enhancement certification to data center
operators that have demonstrated that they will satisfy the enhancement
certification criteria;

! For income tax years commencing on or after 2026, a data center operator
that obtains enhancement certification for a data center project is eligible
for an income tax credit in an amount equal to 10% of the amount of any grid
enhancement and modernization investment made by the data center operator and
an additional amount equal to 5% of the amount of such investment if the
investment is made in a rural area (grid enhancement credit);

! A data center operator is not eligible to claim the grid enhancement credit
until the data center operator has made the required minimum grid enhancement
and modernization investment; and

! In addition to the grid enhancement credit, a data center operator that
obtains enhancement certification for a data center project is eligible for
enhanced utility benefits as negotiated between the data center operator and
the utility.

Before submitting an application for certification for a data center project,
a data center operator is required to conduct and document a preliminary
consultation with the utility that will provide electricity for the data
center project regarding interconnection feasibility, capacity, and
infrastructure requirements and obtain a written feasibility assessment from
the utility. A data center operator is required to include the documentation
of the consultation and the written feasibility assessment with an application
to the office for certification of the data center project, and, if the data
center project includes projects requiring review by the public utilities
commission (commission), the commission is required to review specified
aspects of the application.

A certified data center project that necessitates a new customer load or co-
located customer load that satisfies certain criteria (emerging new load) is
eligible for targeted resource acquisition if the data center operator
satisfies specified requirements. The bill specifies a process by which a
utility regulated by the commission may submit a resource acquisition
application to the commission to meet emerging new load needs. The bill also
specifies how a utility may finance resources and infrastructure needs in
connection with emerging new loads.

After achieving base certification and enhancement certification, a data
center operator may apply to the office for certain benefit extensions for the
sales and use tax exemption allowed to data center operators that have
obtained base certification, for the grid enhancement credit allowed to data
center operators that have obtained enhancement certification, and for the
utility benefits negotiated between the data center operator and the utility.

If the office determines that a data center operator is not fulfilling its
obligations and commitments to retain base certification or enhancement
certification, the office is required to revoke the certification and the data
center operator is required to repay the state for the tax benefits that it
received.

_Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Colorado:_

**SECTION 1.** In Colorado Revised Statutes, **add** part 8 to article 48.5 of
title 24 as follows:

_PART 8_

_DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT_

_AND GRID MODERNIZATION_

_**24-48.5-801. Short title.** THE SHORT TITLE OF THIS PART 8 IS THE "COLORADO
DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT AND GRID MODERNIZATION ACT"._

_**24-48.5-802. Legislative declaration.** (1) THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY FINDS,
DETERMINES, AND DECLARES THAT:_

_(a) COLORADO 'S CONTINUED ECONOMIC GROWTH AND TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCEMENT
DEPEND ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF MODERN DIGITAL INFRASTRUCTURE THAT CAN SUPPORT
EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES WHILE ENSURING GRID RELIABILITY, AFFORDABILITY OF
ELECTRIC SERVICE FOR ALL CUSTOMERS, AND ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY;_

_(b) COLORADO FACES INTERRELATED CHALLENGES IN:_

_(I) ACHIEVING ITS CLEAN ENERGY AND GREENHOUSE GAS REDUCTION GOALS WHILE
MAINTAINING GRID SYSTEM RELIABILITY;_

_(II) MODERNIZING CRITICAL ELECTRICAL GRID INFRASTRUCTURE TO SUPPORT
INCREASING ELECTRIFICATION;_

_(III) ENSURING EQUITABLE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ACROSS URBAN, SUBURBAN, AND
RURAL COMMUNITIES; AND_

_(IV) MAINTAINING ECONOMIC COMPETITIVENESS IN AN EVOLVING TECHNOLOGICAL
LANDSCAPE;_

_(c) THE COLORADO ELECTRIC TRANSMISSION AUTHORITY HAS IDENTIFIED CRITICAL

_**24-48.5-803. Definitions.** AS USED IN THIS PART 8, UNLESS THE CONTEXT
OTHERWISE REQUIRES:_

_(1) "AUTHORITY" MEANS THE COLORADO ELECTRIC TRANSMISSION AUTHORITY CREATED IN
SECTION 40-42-103._

_(2) "BASE CERTIFICATION" MEANS CERTIFICATION GRANTED TO A DATA CENTER PROJECT
THAT SATISFIES THE FUNDAMENTAL QUALIFICATION CRITERIA ESTABLISHED IN SECTION
24-48.5-809._

_(3) "CERTIFIED DATA CENTER PROJECT" MEANS A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT HAS BEEN
CERTIFIED BY THE OFFICE PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-806._

_(4) "COMMISSION" MEANS THE COLORADO PUBLIC UTILITIES COMMISSION CREATED IN
SECTION 40-2-101._

_(5) "DATA CENTER" MEANS A FACILITY THAT:_

_(a) HOUSES INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY EQUIPMENT USED FOR DATA PROCESSING, DATA
STORAGE, OR TELECOMMUNICATIONS; AND_

_(b) HAS A PRIMARY FUNCTION OF DELIVERING INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY SERVICES
INCLUDING:_

_(I) PROVIDING DATA STORAGE, PROCESSING, AND TRANSPORT SERVICES;_

_(II) SUPPORTING THE DELIVERY OF CLOUD COMPUTING SERVICES;_

_(III) PROVIDING NETWORK CONNECTIVITY SERVICES; AND_

_(IV) SUPPORTING ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE, MACHINE LEARNING, OR SIMILAR
COMPUTATIONAL SERVICES._

_(6) "DATA CENTER OPERATOR" MEANS ANY PERSON OR ENTITY THAT:_

_(a) OWNS OR OPERATES A DATA CENTER IN COLORADO;_

_(b) IS A CLIENT OR CO-LOCATION TENANT OR LICENSEE OF A DATA CENTER; OR_

_(c) COLLOCATES INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY EQUIPMENT WITHIN A QUALIFYING DATA
CENTER FACILITY._

_(7) "DATA CENTER PROJECT" MEANS A DESIGNATED AREA THAT AGGREGATES AND CO-
LOCATES ELECTRIC LOADS, INCLUDING ONE OR MORE DATA CENTERS AND RELATED
INFRASTRUCTURE, NEAR CLEAN ENERGY RESOURCES TO OPTIMIZE GRID RESOURCES AND
DELIVER ECONOMIC BENEFITS TO THE COMMUNITY._

_(8) "DEPARTMENT" MEANS THE DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE._

_(9) "EMERGING NEW LOAD" MEANS A NEW CUSTOMER LOAD OR CO-LOCATED CUSTOMER
LOADS THAT:_

_(a) EXCEED ONE HUNDRED MEGAWATTS IN THE AGGREGATE;_

_(b) REQUIRE GRID INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT; AND_

_(c) HAVE A TIMELINE NECESSITATING EXPEDITED RESOURCE PLANNING._

_(10) "ENERGY OFFICE" MEANS THE COLORADO ENERGY OFFICE CREATED IN SECTION
24-38.5-101._

_(11) "ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION" MEANS CERTIFICATION GRANTED TO A DATA CENTER
PROJECT THAT VOLUNTARILY EXCEEDS THE BASE CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS AND
SATISFIES THE ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATION CRITERIA ESTABLISHED IN SECTION
24-48.5-811._

_(12) "GRID ENHANCEMENT INVESTMENT" MEANS CAPITAL INVESTMENT IN ELECTRICAL
INFRASTRUCTURE THAT:_

_(a) IMPROVES THE CAPACITY, RELIABILITY, OR EFFICIENCY OF THE ELECTRICAL
GRID;_

_(b) SUPPORTS THE INTEGRATION OF RENEWABLE AND CLEAN ENERGY RESOURCES;_

_(c) ENHANCES GRID MONITORING, CONTROL, OR OPERATIONAL CAPABILITIES;_

_(d) REDUCES TRANSMISSION CONSTRAINTS OR CONGESTION; AND_

_(e) MEETS SPECIFICATIONS ESTABLISHED BY THE COMMISSION PURSUANT TO THIS PART
8._

_(13) "OFFICE" MEANS THE OFFICE OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT CREATED IN SECTION
24-48.5-101._

_(14) "PROGRAM" MEANS THE DATA CENTER DEVELOPMENT AND GRID MODERNIZATION
PROGRAM CREATED IN THIS PART 8._

_(15) "QUALIFIED PURCHASE" MEANS THE PURCHASE OF:_

_(a) INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY INFRASTRUCTURE INCLUDING:_

_(I) COMPUTER EQUIPMENT AND SOFTWARE;_

_(II) DATA STORAGE SYSTEMS; AND_

_(III) NETWORK INFRASTRUCTURE;_

_(b) DATA CENTER INFRASTRUCTURE AND TRANSMISSION AND GENERATION SYSTEM ASSETS
INCLUDING:_

_(I) ENVIRONMENTAL CONTROL SYSTEMS;_

_(II) ON-SITE ENERGY STORAGE SYSTEMS;_

_(III) ON-SITE RENEWABLE AND CLEAN ENERGY SYSTEMS; AND_

_(IV) BUILDING MATERIALS FOR DATA CENTER CONSTRUCTION;_

_(c) MECHANICAL SYSTEMS; OR_

_(d) OTHER EQUIPMENT ESSENTIAL TO DATA CENTER OPERATIONS._

_(16) "RENEWABLE AND CLEAN ENERGY" MEANS ELECTRICITY GENERATED FROM:_

_(a) SOURCES QUALIFYING AS ELIGIBLE ENERGY RESOURCES PURSUANT TO SECTIONS
30-20-1202 (2) AND 40-2-124, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO:_

_(I) SOLAR;_

_(II) WIND;_

_(III) GEOTHERMAL;_

_(IV) BIOMASS;_

_(V) HYDROELECTRIC;_

_(VI) RECYCLED ENERGY;_

_(VII) NUCLEAR ENERGY; AND_

_(VIII) COAL MINE METHANE WHEN THE COMMISSION DETERMINES IT IS CAPTURED IN A
MANNER THAT CONFORMS WITH ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONS;_

_(b) OTHER CLEAN ENERGY RESOURCES AS DETERMINED BY THE COMMISSION, INCLUDING:_

_(I) GREEN HYDROGEN; AND_

_(II) OTHER EMERGING ZERO-CARBON TECHNOLOGIES; AND_

_(c) ANY COMBINATION OF RESOURCES SPECIFIED IN THIS SUBSECTION (16)._

_(17) "RURAL" MEANS:_

_(a) A COUNTY WITH A POPULATION DENSITY OF LESS THAN ONE HUNDRED PERSONS PER
SQUARE MILE ACCORDING TO THE MOST RECENT FEDERAL CENSUS; OR_

_(b) ANY AREA WITHIN A COUNTY THAT IS:_

_(I) LOCATED OUTSIDE OF A METROPOLITAN STATISTICAL AREA AS DEFINED BY THE
UNITED STATES OFFICE OF MANAGEMENT AND BUDGET;_

_(II) LOCATED AT LEAST FIFTEEN MILES FROM THE CENTRAL BUSINESS DISTRICT OF A
CITY WITH A POPULATION OF FIFTY THOUSAND OR MORE; OR_

_(III) DESIGNATED AS AN ENTERPRISE ZONE PURSUANT TO SECTION 39-30-103._

PURSUANT TO THIS PART 8 SHALL SUBMIT AN APPLICATION TO THE OFFICE, IN A FORM
AND MANNER DETERMINED BY THE OFFICE, THAT INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING:_

_(a) INFORMATION ABOUT THE DATA CENTER PROJECT FOR WHICH THE DATA CENTER
OPERATOR IS SEEKING CERTIFICATION INCLUDING:_

_(I) THE IDENTITY AND QUALIFICATIONS OF THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR TO OWN OR

_(III) EVIDENCE OF SITE CONTROL OR A PATHWAY TO SITE CONTROL;_

_(IV) DEVELOPMENT TIMELINE AND PHASING; AND_

_(V) UTILITY LOAD REQUIREMENTS;_

INCLUDING:_

_(I) THE PROXIMITY OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT TO EXISTING AND PLANNED

_(II) THE PROXIMITY OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT TO CLEAN ENERGY RESOURCES;_

_(III) WATER RESOURCE AVAILABILITY AND A WATER RESOURCES MANAGEMENT PLAN; AND_

_(IV) TRANSPORTATION AND BROADBAND ACCESS;_

INCLUDING:_

_(II) AN EXECUTED INTERCONNECTION AGREEMENT OR UTILITY FEASIBILITY STATEMENT;_

_(III) A GRID INTEGRATION PLAN;_

_(IV) IDENTIFICATION OF NECESSARY GRID INVESTMENTS; AND_

_(V) BINDING COMMITMENTS FOR ALIGNMENT WITH THE HOST UTILITY 'S CLEAN ENERGY

_(d) INVESTMENT AND EMPLOYMENT COMMITMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH THE DATA CENTER
PROJECT INCLUDING:_

_(I) A TIMELINE FOR CAPITAL INVESTMENTS IN DATA CENTER PROJECT CONSTRUCTION
AND EQUIPMENT REACHING A MINIMUM OF TWO HUNDRED FIFTY MILLION DOLLARS WITHIN
SIXTY MONTHS;_

_(II) A TIMELINE FOR CAPITAL INVESTMENTS IN GRID ENHANCEMENT AND MODERNIZATION
REACHING A MINIMUM OF TEN MILLION DOLLARS;_

_(III) A JOB CREATION PLAN SHOWING AT LEAST TWENTY-FIVE NEW FULL-TIME
EQUIVALENT POSITIONS WITH COMPENSATION OF AT LEAST ONE HUNDRED TEN PERCENT OF
THE COUNTY AVERAGE WAGE FOR THE COUNTY IN WHICH THE DATA CENTER PROJECT WILL
BE LOCATED; AND_

_(IV) CONSTRUCTION EMPLOYMENT PROJECTIONS;_

_(e) AN ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY PLAN FOR THE DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT
INCLUDES:_

_(I) A FACILITY CERTIFICATION COMMITMENT, INCLUDING LEED, ENERGY STAR, GREEN

_(II) A WATER STEWARDSHIP STRATEGY;_

_(III) A RENEWABLE ENERGY PROCUREMENT PLAN; AND_

_(IV) ENERGY STORAGE AND GRID SUPPORT CAPABILITIES;_

_(I) AN EXECUTED AGREEMENT WITH THE HOST UTILITY FOR PLANNED GRID

_(II) A DESCRIPTION OF PLANNED GRID INVESTMENTS;_

_(III) A TIMELINE FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE GRID ENHANCEMENT COMMITMENTS;_

_(IV) INTEGRATION WITH UTILITY PLANNING; AND_

_(V) TECHNOLOGIES THAT WILL BE DEPLOYED;_

_(g) COMMUNITY BENEFIT COMMITMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH THE DATA CENTER PROJECT

_(I) WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVES;_

_(II) LOCAL SUPPLIER DEVELOPMENT;_

_(III) TECHNOLOGY TRAINING CENTERS;_

_(IV) CONSERVATION OR OPEN SPACE PROGRAMS; AND_

_(V) OTHER COMMUNITY INVESTMENTS; AND_

_(h) LOCAL GOVERNMENT DOCUMENTATION IN CONNECTION WITH THE DATA CENTER PROJECT

_(I) A RESOLUTION OF SUPPORT FROM THE LOCAL GOVERNING BODY THAT IS THE

_(II) A DESCRIPTION OF APPLICABLE LOCAL INCENTIVES; AND_

_(III) THE STATUS OF LOCAL PERMITS AND APPROVALS._

_(2) (a) AS PART OF THE APPLICATION PROCESS, A DATA CENTER OPERATOR SHALL
PROVIDE TO THE OFFICE AN ATTESTATION THAT:_

_(b) THE OFFICE SHALL KEEP A RECORD OF EACH ATTESTATION SUBMITTED PURSUANT TO

APPLICATION PROCESS, A RESOLUTION OF SUPPORT FROM THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN

_**24-48.5-806. Application review process - opportunity to cure application -
application approval - revocation of certification.** (1) THE OFFICE SHALL
REVIEW ALL APPLICATIONS SUBMITTED PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-805. THE OFFICE
SHALL DETERMINE WHETHER AN APPLICATION IS COMPLETE WITHIN FIFTEEN DAYS AFTER
THE OFFICE'S RECEIPT OF THE APPLICATION. WITHIN SIXTY DAYS OF DETERMINING THAT

REVIEW._

_(2) IF THE OFFICE DETERMINES THAT AN APPLICATION IS DEFICIENT, THE OFFICE

CURE ANY DEFICIENCIES IN THE APPLICATION AND COMPLETE A REVIEW OF THE REVISED
APPLICATION WITHIN THIRTY DAYS AFTER RECEIPT._

_(3) THE OFFICE SHALL APPROVE AN APPLICATION FOR BASE OR ENHANCEMENT
CERTIFICATION FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT IF IT CONTAINS ALL OF THE FOLLOWING:_

_(b) ATTESTATION AS SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-805 (2) THAT THE DATA CENTER

_(c) DOCUMENTATION OF APPROVAL FROM THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN WHICH THE DATA
CENTER WILL BE LOCATED AS SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-805 (3)._

_(4) THE OFFICE MAY REJECT AN APPLICATION ONLY ON THE FOLLOWING GROUNDS:_

_(a) THE OFFICE FINDS THAT THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR MATERIALLY MISREPRESENTED

_(b) THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR FAILED TO PROVIDE REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION AFTER
THE OFFICE PROVIDED AN OPPORTUNITY TO CURE PURSUANT TO SUBSECTION (2) OF THIS
SECTION;_

_(c) THE OFFICE DETERMINES THAT THERE IS A DOCUMENTED INABILITY OF LOCAL
INFRASTRUCTURE TO SUPPORT THE DATA CENTER PROJECT DESPITE COMMITMENTS FROM THE
DATA CENTER OPERATOR; OR_

_(d) THE OFFICE DETERMINES THAT A CLEAR INCONSISTENCY EXISTS BETWEEN THE DATA

_(a) CONSULT WITH THE ENERGY OFFICE, THE COMMISSION, AND THE DEPARTMENT OF

_(b) PROVIDE THE APPLICANT AN OPPORTUNITY TO ADDRESS THE OFFICE 'S CONCERNS;

_(c) EXPLORE ALTERNATIVE PATHS TO APPROVAL WITH CONDITIONS IF POSSIBLE._

_(6) THE OFFICE MAY REVOKE CERTIFICATION THAT IT HAS AWARDED PURSUANT TO THIS

_(a) HAS FAILED TO MAKE SUBSTANTIAL PROGRESS TOWARD SATISFYING THE

_(b) HAS MATERIALLY CHANGED THE DATA CENTER PROJECT IN WAYS THAT WOULD HAVE

_**24-48.5-808. Targeted resource acquisition for emerging new loads.** (1) A

_(f) THE STANDARD OF REVIEW OF THE COMMISSION 'S DECISION ON A UTILITY'S

_(g) IF THE UTILITY IDENTIFIES SPECIFIC RESOURCES, THE UTILITY IS NOT REQUIRED
TO APPLY FOR OR OBTAIN A CERTIFICATE OF PUBLIC CONVENIENCE AND NECESSITY
PURSUANT TO SECTION 40-5-102._

_(h) THE COMMISSION SHALL APPROVE, MODIFY, OR DENY APPLICATIONS WITHIN ONE

_(3) (a) UTILITIES MAY INCLUDE PRE-FUNDING COMMITMENTS FROM THE OPERATOR OF

_(b) FOR CERTIFIED DATA CENTERS, THE UTILITY SHALL COORDINATE WITH THE OFFICE

_**24-48.5-809. Certified data center project status - base certification -
application - requirements - qualification.**(1) A DATA CENTER OPERATOR MAY
APPLY TO THE OFFICE PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-805 TO OBTAIN BASE
CERTIFICATION FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT. A DATA CENTER OPERATOR MUST APPLY TO
THE OFFICE FOR BASE CERTIFICATION BEFORE SATISFYING ANY OF THE CRITERIA
SPECIFIED IN SUBSECTION (2) OF THIS SECTION._

_(2) TO QUALIFY FOR BASE CERTIFICATION, A DATA CENTER OPERATOR MUST
DEMONSTRATE TO THE OFFICE THAT IT COMMITS TO:_

_(a) MAKE A MINIMUM CAPITAL INVESTMENT OF TWO HUNDRED FIFTY MILLION DOLLARS IN
DATA CENTER FACILITY CONSTRUCTION AND EQUIPMENT WITHIN SIXTY MONTHS OF
OBTAINING BASE CERTIFICATION FROM THE OFFICE AS SPECIFIED IN SECTION
24-48.5-805 (1)(d);_

_(b) CREATE TWENTY-FIVE NEW FULL-TIME EQUIVALENT JOBS WITH AN AVERAGE
COMPENSATION OF AT LEAST ONE HUNDRED TEN PERCENT OF THE COUNTY AVERAGE WAGE IN
THE COUNTY IN WHICH THE DATA CENTER PROJECT WILL BE CONSTRUCTED;_

_(c) IMPLEMENT BASIC GRID SUPPORT CAPABILITIES INCLUDING:_

_(I) INSTALLATION OF LOAD MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS; AND_

_(II) COORDINATION WITH TRANSMISSION PLANNING EFFORTS;_

_(d) OBTAIN CERTIFICATION UNDER ONE OF THE FOLLOWING STANDARDS WITHIN TWENTY-
FOUR MONTHS OF THE DATA CENTER PROJECT BEING PLACED IN SERVICE:_

_(I) LEED FOR DATA CENTERS AT SILVER LEVEL OR HIGHER;_

_(II) ENERGY STAR CERTIFICATION;_

_(III) GREEN GLOBES CERTIFICATION;_

_(IV) ISO 50001 ENERGY MANAGEMENT CERTIFICATION;_

_(V) ISO 14001 STANDARD FOR ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS; OR_

_(VI) OTHER EQUIVALENT STANDARDS APPROVED BY THE OFFICE;_

_(e) IMPLEMENT WATER STEWARDSHIP STRATEGIES THAT OPTIMIZE OPERATIONAL WATER
MANAGEMENT THROUGH ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING:_

_(I) IMPLEMENTATION OF CLOSED-LOOP COOLING SYSTEMS;_

_(II) USE OF AVAILABLE RECYCLED WATER SOURCES OR WATER RIGHTS PREVIOUSLY
RESERVED FOR RETIRING THERMAL POWER UNITS;_

_(III) DEPLOYMENT OF WATER-EFFICIENT TECHNOLOGIES; OR_

_(IV) REGULAR EFFICIENCY AUDITING AND IMPROVEMENT;_

_(f) ALIGN WITH THE ACTUAL ATTAINMENT OF THE CLEAN ENERGY PLAN OF THE UTILITY
THAT WILL SERVE THE DATA CENTER PROJECT, IF THE ENERGY IS AVAILABLE, THROUGH
THE UTILITY 'S UPDATE TO ITS CEP WORKBOOK, EITHER SUBMITTED TO THE COMMISSION
OR APPROVED BY THE UTILITY'S BOARD, WITHIN TEN YEARS OF THE DATA CENTER
PROJECT BEING PLACED IN SERVICE THROUGH ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING OR OTHER
SOURCES DESIGNATED BY THE COMMISSION OR MUNICIPAL OR COOPERATIVE BOARD FOR
NONJURISDICTIONAL UTILITIES:_

_(I) COLLOCATED RENEWABLE AND CLEAN ENERGY GENERATION FACILITIES;_

_(II) DIRECT POWER PURCHASE AGREEMENTS WITH NEW RENEWABLE AND CLEAN ENERGY
FACILITIES LOCATED IN COLORADO;_

_(III) ENROLLMENT IN A UTILITY-ADMINISTERED VOLUNTARY GREEN PRICING PROGRAM
APPROVED BY THE COMMISSION;_

_(IV) EXECUTION OF A POWER PURCHASE AGREEMENT WITH A MERCHANT POWER PRODUCER
THAT SOURCES ELECTRICITY FROM RENEWABLE OR CLEAN RESOURCES IN ALIGNMENT WITH
THE STATE 'S CLEAN ENERGY GOALS;_

_(V) DIRECT OWNERSHIP OR PROCUREMENT OF BEHIND-THE-METER RENEWABLE OR CLEAN
ENERGY GENERATION, WITH VERIFIABLE TRACKING OF ENERGY CONSUMPTION; OR_

_(VI) THE PURCHASE OF RENEWABLE ENERGY CERTIFICATES ENSURING COMPLIANCE WITH
THE STATE 'S RENEWABLE ENERGY TARGETS;_

_(g) SUPPORT CLEAN ENERGY INTEGRATION THROUGH COORDINATION WITH THE UTILITY OR
THE IMPLEMENTATION OF ENERGY STORAGE SOLUTIONS THAT ALIGN WITH FACILITY NEEDS
AND OPERATIONS;_

_(h) BREAK GROUND ON THE DATA CENTER PROJECT WITHIN SIXTY MONTHS OF OBTAINING
BASE CERTIFICATION; AND_

_(i) COMMIT TO SATISFYING THE DATA CENTER PROJECT REQUIREMENTS AFTER
CERTIFICATION SPECIFIED IN SECTION 24-48.5-815._

_(3) (a) UPON RECEIPT OF AN APPLICATION FOR BASE CERTIFICATION FROM A DATA
CENTER OPERATOR, THE OFFICE SHALL REVIEW THE APPLICATION PURSUANT TO SECTION
24-48.5-806. IF THE OFFICE APPROVES THE DATA CENTER PROJECT FOR BASE

_**24-48.5-813. Benefit extension and modification - duration - extension
eligibility - extension terms.** (1) A DATA CENTER OPERATOR THAT HAS OBTAINED
BASE CERTIFICATION OR ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION FOR A DATA CENTER PROJECT MAY
APPLY TO THE OFFICE FOR AN EXTENSION OF THE BASE CERTIFICATION BENEFITS OR THE
ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION BENEFITS. TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR A BENEFIT EXTENSION, A
DATA CENTER OPERATOR MUST DEMONSTRATE THAT:_

_(a) THE CERTIFIED DATA CENTER HAS MADE ADDITIONAL GRID ENHANCEMENT
INVESTMENTS IN A TOTAL AMOUNT OF AT LEAST FIVE MILLION DOLLARS DURING THE
INITIAL TWENTY-YEAR BENEFIT PERIOD;_

_(b) THE CERTIFIED DATA CENTER PROJECT HAS CREATED AT LEAST TEN NEW QUALIFYING
JOBS IN ADDITION TO THE JOBS THAT THE DATA CENTER OPERATOR IS REQUIRED TO
CREATE PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-809 (2)(b);_

_(c) THE CERTIFIED DATA CENTER PROJECT CONTINUES TO COMPLY WITH ENVIRONMENTAL
REQUIREMENTS; AND_

_(d) THE CERTIFIED DATA CENTER PROJECT HAS SATISFIED ITS COMMUNITY BENEFIT
COMMITMENTS PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-815._

_(2) A CERTIFIED DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT IS APPROVED FOR A BENEFIT EXTENSION
PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION IS ELIGIBLE FOR:_

_(a) AN ADDITIONAL TEN YEARS OF ELIGIBILITY TO CLAIM THE SALES AND USE TAX
EXEMPTION AND THE INCOME TAX CREDIT ALLOWED PURSUANT TO THIS PART 8; AND_

_(b) THE ABILITY OF THE CERTIFIED DATA CENTER TO MAINTAIN THE REQUIREMENTS OF
ITS ORIGINAL BASE OR ENHANCEMENT-LEVEL CERTIFICATION._

_**24-48.5-814. Local government authority and coordination.** (1) THIS PART 8
DOES NOT LIMIT LOCAL GOVERNMENT AUTHORITY REGARDING PROPERTY TAX INCENTIVES,
LAND USE DECISIONS, DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENTS, LOCAL PERMITS AND APPROVALS, OR

CASE OF A MUNICIPALLY-OWNED UTILITY. THIS PART 8 ALSO DOES NOT REQUIRE LOCAL
GOVERNMENTS TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM._

_(2) THE OFFICE MAY ESTABLISH PROCEDURES FOR COORDINATING WITH LOCAL
GOVERNMENTS REGARDING DATA CENTER PROJECT REVIEW, INFRASTRUCTURE PLANNING,
ENVIRONMENTAL COMPLIANCE, THE PROVISION OF TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND THE
FACILITATION OF INFORMATION SHARING BETWEEN JURISDICTIONS._

_**24-48.5-815. Data center project requirements after certification -
community benefit requirements - workforce development - economic development
integration.** (1) A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT HAS OBTAINED BASE CERTIFICATION
OR ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION SHALL PARTICIPATE IN AT LEAST ONE STATE WORKFORCE
DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM, INCLUDING:_

_(a) PARTNERSHIPS WITH LOCAL EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS INCLUDING:_

_(I) TECHNICAL TRAINING PROGRAMS;_

_(II) APPRENTICESHIP INITIATIVES;_

_(III) CAREER PATHWAY DEVELOPMENT; AND_

_(IV) SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING, AND MATH (STEM) EDUCATION SUPPORT;
AND_

_(b) LOCAL WORKFORCE INITIATIVES INCLUDING:_

_(I) JOB TRAINING PROGRAMS;_

_(II) SKILLS DEVELOPMENT WORKSHOPS;_

_(III) PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATION SUPPORT; AND_

_(IV) CAREER ADVANCEMENT OPPORTUNITIES._

_(2) A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT HAS OBTAINED BASE CERTIFICATION OR ENHANCEMENT
CERTIFICATION SHALL PARTICIPATE IN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT INTEGRATION BY:_

_(a) PARTICIPATING IN REGIONAL ECONOMIC PLANNING;_

_(b) SUPPORTING SUPPLY CHAIN DEVELOPMENT;_

_(c) ENABLING TECHNOLOGY CLUSTER FORMATION; AND_

_(d) FOSTERING INNOVATION ECOSYSTEM GROWTH._

_**24-48.5-816. Preservation of existing data center project certification.**
(1) A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT IS CERTIFIED PRIOR TO JANUARY 1, 2035, IS
REQUIRED TO COMPLY WITH THE FOLLOWING REQUIREMENTS TO MAINTAIN ITS
CERTIFICATION:_

_(a) MAINTAIN ALL COMMITMENTS THROUGH ITS TWENTY-YEAR BENEFIT PERIOD;_

_(b) RETAIN ELIGIBILITY FOR EXTENSIONS PURSUANT TO SECTION 24-48.5-810;_

_(c) CONTINUE COMPLIANCE OBLIGATIONS; AND_

_(d) SUBMIT THE PERFORMANCE REPORTS REQUIRED IN SECTIONS 24-48.5-809 (5) AND
24-48.5-811 (5)._

_**24-48.5-817. Program cost recovery.** (1) (a) TO RECOVER THE DIRECT COSTS

_(II) ESTABLISH AND COLLECT A NONREFUNDABLE CERTIFICATION FEE NOT TO EXCEED

_**24-48.5-818. Implementation within existing resources.** (1) EXCEPT AS

_(2) EXCEPT AS OTHERWISE PROVIDED IN SECTION 24-48.5-817, THE COMMISSION AND

_(4) THE OFFICE MAY:_

_(a) ESTABLISH REASONABLE APPLICATION AND CERTIFICATION FEES TO OFFSET THE

_(b) STRUCTURE THE APPLICATION REVIEW PROCESSES TO EFFICIENTLY USE EXISTING

_(c) COORDINATE WITH OTHER STATE AGENCIES TO LEVERAGE EXISTING TECHNICAL
EXPERTISE._

**SECTION 2.** In Colorado Revised Statutes, **add** 39-22-571 as follows:

_**39-22-571. Certified data center projects - grid enhancement investments -
tax credit - tax preference performance statement - legislative declaration -
definitions - repeal.** (1) (a) IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECTION 39-21-304 (1),

THE INCOME TAX YEARS POSSIBLE. ANY AMOUNT OF THE TAX CREDIT THAT IS NOT USED

_(6) NOTWITHSTANDING SECTION 39-21-304 (4), THE CREDIT ALLOWED PURSUANT TO
THIS SECTION CONTINUES INDEFINITELY._

**SECTION 3.** In Colorado Revised Statutes, **add** 39-26-735 as follows:

_**39-26-735. Certified data center projects - qualified purchases -
information technology infrastructure - data center infrastructure - electric
grid enhancement equipment - tax preference performance statement -
legislative declaration - definitions - repeal.** (1) (a) IN ACCORDANCE WITH

ANY AVAILABLE INFORMATION THAT WOULD ASSIST THE STATE AUDITOR 'S ANALYSIS._

_(a) "CERTIFIED DATA CENTER PROJECT" MEANS A DATA CENTER PROJECT THAT HAS
OBTAINED EITHER BASE CERTIFICATION OR ENHANCEMENT CERTIFICATION STATUS FROM

OF TITLE 24._

_(b) "STATE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION CERTIFICATE" MEANS A CERTIFICATE
ISSUED BY THE COLORADO OFFICE OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT TO A CERTIFIED DATA
CENTER PURSUANT TO PART 8 OF ARTICLE 48.5 OF TITLE 24._

_(3) BEGINNING JANUARY 1, 2026, ALL SALES, STORAGE, AND USE OF INFORMATION

OTHER EQUIPMENT ESSENTIAL TO DATA CENTER OPERATIONS AS DESCRIBED IN SECTION
24-48.5-803 (15) THAT WILL BE USED IN CONNECTION WITH A CERTIFIED DATA CENTER
PROJECT THAT HAS A STATE SALES AND USE TAX EXEMPTION CERTIFICATE IS EXEMPT
FROM TAXATION UNDER PARTS 1 AND 2 OF THIS ARTICLE 26._

_(4) NOTWITHSTANDING SECTION 39-21-304 (4), THE EXEMPTION ALLOWED PURSUANT TO
THIS SECTION CONTINUES INDEFINITELY._

**SECTION 4. Applicability.** This act applies to data center projects for

**SECTION 5. Safety clause.** The general assembly finds, determines, and

Author: Hinrichsen

PREAMENDED
